StyzMqbV6M-ojKzHxJifag.text: Had our 12th anniversary dinner here tonight (party of 8) and it was excellent! The food, service and personal attention were wonderful. We had some vegan/vegetarian guests and they were all effortlessly taken care of. Everyone loved their meals. Fiona is lovely! It exceeded expectations, I would highly recommend.

CB4G2CrfquZ0_8xKzIo4pw.text: This is a lovely local restaurant. We had our last meal in London at Ffiona's and it was amazing. The restaurant is very cozy. You feel as if you are entering the home of a dear friend. We started with the scallops and kale appetizer. Both were very tasty. For entrees I had the Chicken Kiev and my husband had the lamb. Both were awesome and full of great favors. The meat is locally sourced and was so tender. Ffiona and her staff were super helpful with suggestions and very kind. This is a must try when in London.

gi0Yvly0yjLw1bXV-nHJZQ.text: I had their fresh fish of the day was haddock with capers, lemon, and mash on the sides. It was incredible, especially since my last few experiences with haddock started to make me think that haddock was a tasteless fish. Majority of their foods land from 15-20 pounds. The main waitress (who seemed to be in charge of most of the tables) was nice and when she had time, she sat down and got to know me for awhile. The other waitress was also very respectful and kind. The environment is kind of dark, but really cute with music wallpaper everywhere. Pricey dinner for a backpacker, but overall it was a very good meal. :)

PuKmCiOP2PSB0Ih7tICEPg.text: I cannot say enough about Ffiona's & Ffiona (owner/waitress/all-around fantastic lady!). After a few subpar dining experiences on my first trip to London - Ffiona's was an absolutely amazing experience.I walked in without a reservation and instead of turning me away because she was all booked up, she eagerly figured out how to get me a table and after seating me quickly returned with bread and water - which I desperately needed after spending the whole afternoon wandering around London.Ffiona & her sidekick (who was also fantastic) were the only waitresses in the tiny establishment, but managed to keep an almost symphonic hold over the flow of the food, drinks and overall service in the restaurant.The food was incredible - I got the grilled avocado starter and then went with the classic fish & chips (which were my first fish & chips in London and actually first ever when I think about it.) Both were absolutely delicious.As amazing as the food was, it was almost an after-thought compared to the service and atmosphere that made me feel like I was at home (in the best home I could possibly imagine) even though I was thousands of miles away from my real home in NYC. That being said, I've dined in some really great establishments in New York, but Ffiona's was by far one of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant.Not only is the entire place just awesome in every way (I really can't say enough!), but I overheard some great stories that Ffiona was telling to other tables - including that she serves a classic American Thanksgiving and that the first sitting of which, is entirely free for anyone that wants it. THIS WOMAN IS AN ANGEL!Thank you Ffiona for being so welcoming, friendly, and giving me such a fantastic experience. You and your restaurant optimize exactly what I imagined all the best parts of London to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips :)
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Avocado Starter - amazing!

nNAwqojy0RkdmMTEoeBnHg.text: Really a top-notch restaurant right in the heart of Kensington. On holiday from the US, we stopped in for dinner on our first night with no reservation - we hadn't realized ahead of time that the restaurant was so small (less than 10 tables). However, the owner managed to squeeze us in between bookings in the back room. Speaking of, the owner was quite pleasant and very passionate in describing the details of the daily specials, which were written on the large black boards adorning the walls. We settled on the asparagus and scallops for starters and the lamb and chicken kiev for mains - all of which were stunning. Highly recommend visiting Ffionas and treating yourself to a nice dinner - but book early; you may not be so lucky as to stroll in and happen upon a table.

AhBEVKzCmisDCLWzcOh4wQ.text: Amazing service and food! Exactly what we were looking for. A perfect dinner! Ffiona is a great hostess.

Zf8Ib-AT7juxh3-bfQ0YcA.text: Wonderful find. The food was delicious. We had the prawns appetizer, the lamb and the chicken kiev. All perfectly cooked and wonderful. Ffiona is a great hostess. Limited seating so get reservations.

2EjBcBVe83f1sPycPTROYA.text: This was our first dinner in London and we were blown away.  The fish and chips and chicken Kiev were incredible!  Custard with the crumble dessert is very delicious.  Service is wonderful and Ffiona was fun to chat with.  We will be back!

Nq8bPt-BCDrLU5Qy85mxpQ.text: Yelp brought us together. What a great place!! Really nice people, cozy ambiance and great food. As a Dutchy I've never had typical English food (not fish&chips!). I loved it. High quality, fresh products. You won't regret this one.

joG-jnEimM5j8ETcZY2FuQ.text: Stumbled upon this place while walking through the neighborhood.  The food was excellent, service superb and had a welcoming vibe.  The ingredients are clearly high quality.

PaY-soBn_DsDMXRBqFmx3w.text: Ffiona's is a neighborhood restaurant featuring fresh ingredients, excellent preparation and impeccable service. We try to include dinner and the occasional brunch every time we visit London, and have never been disappointed. My only concern is that the word is out beyond Kensington and this small restaurant is becoming 'popular' (in the good way). I hope it retains its friendly neighborhood feel, but I'm sure it will given the care that host Fiona gives to each and every guest. If you want to eat like the well-informed locals do, try Ffiona's and you will not be disappointed.Just returned to Ffionas in July 2016, and it is just as good as ever. We try to make it every time we are in London.

yHF6d4WkG45lLlcu2quNaQ.text: What a find!  To all our friends who visit from the states - and to everyone else as well - this is a truly great place.  We went first for dinner and, based in throat, immediately made reservations for Sunday brunch.  Both were superb.  And Fiona is a wonderful host.Only one word of advice:  Go!

-cZRE1I0woS6FNEjmOqU_w.text: Tired and hungry from a long day of trying to get from Nantes to London, this place was close to our rental flat and it looked very inviting. It didn't look like they would be able to seat us, but they did have a table. Great service and wonderful food--they were helpful with suggestions and made us feel like regulars. Will more than likely stop here again during our stay in London.

E59yRoGvCr2nX2Oa7Z30eQ.text: Candlelight, garden flowers, exquisite food and spirits, and the charm and warmth of Ffiona herself make this a special and intimate place to eat. The grilled avocado salad was sublime, only to be exceeded by Succulent Welsh rump lamb in au jus with mint sauce, rainbow root salad with gogi berries, mashed potatoes with leeks, and the most delicious Pimms cup i've ever had. I returned 3 nights later with colleagues and we had an equally divine experience. My neighbor recommended Ffionas, but I met three fellow foodies in the airline industry who assured me it was their home away from home. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pimms to die for
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Best Pimms ever, melt in your mouth lamb, rainbow salad and mashed potatoes with leeks

L9R-ar-AAcnQMmghk07KwQ.text: Fantastic place, delicious food, and Ffiona is a warm and welcoming rock star!  Eggs Benedict with spot-on hollandaise, vegan options too--they are inclusive!

s3abcDQz0cZ7tIuh6tJOAA.text: Thank you ffiona for such an amazing meal with my family in London. They came all the way from California to taste your chicken Kiev. The trip was totally worth it. Glad we booked this place as getting a table for six would be difficult. The atmosphere was rustic and candlelit.  They brought large jugs of ice water for the table which was very nice. Drinks- a gin and tonic and a bottle of white wine were fine. Appetizers we ordered were the vegetable soup which was more of a purée of vegetables and the watermelon mint feta salad. We enjoyed both flavor combinations. The STAR of the night was the chicken Kiev. Unbelievable. Heart stoppingly filled with butter and herbs. Perfectly cooked and tender with a crispy outside. One of my favorite dinners of the year if not the decade.  Already planning to come back.  The rice and carrot sides went well with the melted butter that oozed from the kievs. To top our dinner off, we had two sticky toffee puddings (this sauce was well done), Eton mess, and a blueberry custard. All were fantastic but not too heavy. Again I cannot wait to return. Thank you for making my families visit more memorable.

_FWfKDpgy4gmkX4FWNw6mA.text: I lived around the corner and would go here for brunch with friends almost every weekend for two years. Very warm hostesses - expect a hug once you're a regular. Rustic atmosphere. Incredible food.My favorites - pancakes or waffles with bacon or sausage. The Sunday roast is decadent!Top 10 brunch place for London

CHCkKM6AtnWqpystgR0KCw.text: Ffiona's was my favorite meal during my trip to England this summer. The ambiance is intimate and romantic, and the service from Ffiona and the wait staff was amazing. I ordered the highly recommended chicken kiev and it was amazing, as promised. I will definitely come back to Ffiona's if I'm ever in Notting Hill again.

4cBbnEbE0Fhs_D7x7vXS5A.text: Ate at Ffionas on our first night in London. Absolutely wonderful food and service. Chatted with Fiona herself who is so lovely! Cute and quaint restaurant that is highly recommended.

kWqV-IBrzakPfaFyzqJe7A.text: Delicious food and great service. You'll meet the owner, and if you're traveling she will provide great suggestions for activities in addition to a great dinner. Worth the detour into Kensington!

MVJ2PcgktZ7kfpO0VK9D0g.text: Wonderful! We found this restaurant via Yelp and were so delighted with it. All of our dishes were outstanding and the service and ambience were perfect. Highly recommend.

9FQqRBKsDshV5TRpSFql3w.text: First of all, make a reservation!Second, British food is delicious over there!The place is nice, Fiona is extra nice and the food is really good!If you need any help they will explain everything you need to know before you order. The place is charming and lovely with lights coming out of candles.At first we thought it was a bit pricey but with this quality of food and compare to others restaurants, it's definitely not that pricey!If you are looking to end a day nicely, this is the place to go to.PS : the chicken Kiev is a must try

emyDff2LTaFuVsI32rGOBw.text: The food in this restaurant, run by a Welsh woman, is extraordinary. We had a squid appetizer that was so good we were seriously considering ordering the dish again at  the same meal.  Wine and cocktails are excellent. Service is solid.  Setting is homey and sweet. Definitely a hit.

ABTrDOE_3c1ymmWhhhEm_g.text: Visiting from California for the second summer in a row and both times enjoyed this fantastic dining experience-- we were not disappointed. "Probably the best chicken Kiev in the world" Atmosphere is wonderful, food is terrific, service is fantastic, and Miss Ffiona was an absolute joy to meet.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Our family loves ffiona's!!

iFq47slie6IvLv3qXCJ9dw.text: We really liked this place a lot, Fiona was very personable as was her server. We were walk ins with not having "booked" a table yet she accommodated our party of 3. She made a tequila cocktail she called "summer in a glass" which was very refreshing. We had steak, spiraled sweet potato pasta, chicken Kiev which was a big hit. A yummy green salad shared with fresh parmesan dressing!

10wsKjjvRa9lemIJ3KIjYg.text: good place i think there are alot of features that make aperson like this place

jCaDh2LdR1WqbhAfkRW_5Q.text: What a fantastic little restaurant!  Staff was amazingly friendly and made the experience so much more enjoyable.  Chicken Kiev was very good.  The duck breast special was very tasty.  And we couldn't pass on the desserts... both were very good.

MiZO9zR-qHz0Lv8W-bagzQ.text: Absolutely gorgeous food. I ordered a vegetable soup and a chicken Kiev. The menu is written only on a blackboard on the left wall, which is not admittedly the most convenient but gives the place a nice, cozy feel (there is, however, a printed drink menu).The vegetable soup came in a moderate-sized cup and was fairly thick like a puree. All the vegetables, herbs, and spices used came together beautifully.The chicken Kiev was amazing, from its perfectly crusted exterior to the moist and tender breast meat. Many a restaurant in the moderately high price range will serve up chicken that is dry and tasteless, so for them to make it not only well but extremely well is impressive. The texture was soft but not mushy, and melted in your mouth. The garlic butter filling and the sauce on the outside helped enhance the flavor of the dish.95/100

eemIsoHMXYdwJ7EVvqEJhw.text: Delicious food and very friendly service. Walked in by myself without a reservation for Sunday brunch and they were able to squeeze me in! Extremely accommodating and their beetroot eggs benedict special was absolutely amazing!

oHIRX9I472LbQ6kO7iVywQ.text: My wife and I and a couple friends tried Ffiona's for a Sunday brunch and had a great experience.  I'd highly recommend the full English breakfast.  Fiona and staff are very friendly.  Be sure to make a reservation because it fills up quickly!

6OPi90G_BPhg6uv0b8ZZTw.text: Never disappointing.  I go to Ffionas on every trip to London. The pate is so delicious.

33cW35mbnUB2M05Ky5x9cQ.text: Very refreshing considering  I spent 5 hours stuck  in JFK and 12 hours flight. The atmosphere  is definitely  different  from  that of the US. The 3 blueberry pancakes were wonderful.Thank you.

DKkSgWxQj09U4DkZpgZyag.text: Really. superb. Our second night in London, and I'm not sure we can top this in the remaining 2 weeks of our European vacation!! I made a reservation with the owner a few days beforehand after seeing the yelp reviews. I was surprised that she responds directly! I would recommend making a reservation as it is a small place, very quaint and "homey" feeling. Ffiona greeted us and went over the menu when we arrived. We had the scallops as a starter, each had an entree: lamb, pork chop and fish cakes, and shared sides: spicy squash, mash and greens. Everything was cooked perfectly!! The meat melts in your mouth, the veggies were seasoned beautifully and we had delicious cocktails to accompany our meal. The experience is also very personal as Ffiona is very attentive. Don't make the mistake of missing out on this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Our cocktails! We dug into the food so fast we didn't get pics!

lVJtJxg5azLVLcsp48L0lA.text: One of the finest meals I've ever had and by far the warmest/personal customer service I've ever received in London.

T9BSqdDQNSIMHSzM1g-XIQ.text: Can't go wrong here, sticky toffee puddings and custard, takes me back to my school days, thank you.

N8TedQkN33y6QNVFhFQKEw.text: I heard about this place from my friends I finally gave it a try after some shopping in Soho as we passed by this location and the queue.They don't take reservations, same as many causal restaurants in London. Be aware of some wait time to eat around London town in Zone 1 (city center) if you are just visiting and not familiar with the local food scene. The restaurant has two levels, it's not small but definitely crowded. Tables are quite close to one another, they play hit songs in the background with a causal and friendly hipster vibe. That's how I would describe it.  The menu is very simple. The One & Only main item is The iron steak. You might choose  sides and sauce. It comes with a side salad. We liked the fries, creamy spinach, and the horseradish and also peppercorn sauce to accompany the steak. Oh, and not to mention, the meal comes with a cup of warm buttery popcorn .I am also a sucker on presentation of the food. The little cleaver is a cute touch ! You can purchase it as you wish as well For the quality and the price, you really cannot go wrong here! I would say my experience matched up with the hype!

UYNDyb9PkpEYerdu0n5mxA.text: A small charming restaurant serving classic British foods. I absolutely loved the Chicken Kiev!  The homemade vegetable soup was soothing and tasty. Service was fantastic and very friendly. I also liked the sticky toffee pudding dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Kiev

YZXwnKb93r4btiEp2PdFrw.text: How do I even begin when a restaurant leaves such a beautiful & emotional impact upon you?On my last night in London, I was alone and switched to a hotel near Kensington Gardens and was starving for a place to eat. I pulled out Yelp and found Ffiona's and knew I had to try it based on the menu since I'm vegan/vegetarian. I walked in right as they opened and was warmly greeted by FFiona herself.The inside of the restaurant is the most quaint, beautiful little place I've ever stepped foot into. I wish so badly my boyfriend hadn't been working and that he could have joined me - this is definitely a great place to bring a date! However, even though I was all alone, Ffiona made me feel like I was part of the family - she herself is a warm, welcoming hostess. I ordered the Grilled avocado appetizer and was blown away. Fresh, full of flavor, and absolutely delicious. What a way to start a meal! I could eat that every single day.For my main course, I had the Courgetti and Sweet potato noodles - WOW. Raw, vegan, AND delicious? You can't beat it. I doubt any meat eater could find issue with this dish - amazing.And or course, I had to order the Sticky Toffee Pudding for dessert on my last night here. It was fantastic - melt in your mouth delicious.I was lucky enough to be the only patron in the restaurant the whole time I was there (I guess I can thank the warm weather, early dinner time, and the fact it was a Tuesday night). I was able to chat to Ffiona for most of my time and it really made the experience that much more beautiful. Truly, my dinner at Ffiona's was nearly life-changing - I've never been so emotionally affected by a meal before. The experience was so beautiful and so loving from start to finish - I left the restaurant feeling full and happy, though it made leaving London so much harder. Ffiona - if I could pack up you and this lovely restaurant and bring it back to New York, I would. This place is hands down my FAVORITE restaurant - US, UK, or otherwise. What a place! What a meal! I'll be telling everyone I know about this place and on my future trips to London, I'll be visiting you and bringing my friends and my appetite. Thank you for such a wonderful experience to leave London on such a high note xo

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled avocado appetizer - amazing!

0EJItWlkPmnF8BPBue7ozQ.text: We are on vacation from San Francisco and found this restaurant on yelp. We are so happy we spent our first night in London at Ffionas, it was amazing! The food was great but most of all the 2 ladies that run the place are the sweetest can be and treat you like family. We even got to talk and share about one of their trips to California and had lots of jokes! We love this place! 1000000x recommended!
