OHZn7h0Wtme9wCXWJj82LA.text: Could not recommend this restaurant enough! My family and I came for the Thanksgiving dinner and every part of the meal was unbelievably delicious. They even allowed a specific request for us: Pumpkin Pie! Accommodating for vegetarians and very friendly and open, an amazing experience we'll never forget.

0xcDiXjmK1WQ3BtdBEvGlg.text: If you want to feel like you're having a fabulous home cooked meal, served by one of the nicest and funniest persons you'll ever meet, this is your place. Have the lamb; always superb.

pS9xpOGBBJsoxzwymNyB0Q.text: A couple of days late, but yet again, another amazing dinner his past Friday 01 December! Ffiona is the best! Her food literally sings! Since discovering this Kensington gem, I don't have dinner anywhere else whenever I'm in London! Don't delay! Go!This is one of the best spots in London! Ffiona is amazing. She's outstanding at what she does, hence why she's been in business for 24yrs! The food is just like home. Made with love, and full of comfort. Ffiona and her crew welcome you with open arms and treat you like family. Nothing on the menu will disappoint!

0e5nTHiC1QXLHYqMy5WwpQ.text: One of the things I look most forward to about going to London is going to  Ffiona's.This place is unlike any other restaurant. It truly is magical.From the moment you enter you feel like you are walking into a dear friends home. That's how Ffiona makes you feel, that you are a part of her family. She is filled with warmth,  kindness and she gives the best hugs.Now, the food. THE FOOD! Favorites- The chicken Kiev haunts me. It's that good.I get the same thing every time I go here, and I'm not tempted to try anything else. The chicken is so tender, filled with yummy goodness as you cut into the middle. It is a must have.The sticky toffee pudding with custard is the best sticky toffee pudding I've ever had, and I've had more than my share.I could go on and on, but I won't bore you. If you want an exceptional dining experience. Go to Ffiona's. It's that simple, just make sure to call and make a reservation!**We miss you already Ffiona! Till next time. From your friends in L.A :)

ZCVVLKGP87Z_btIDJQT_Bg.text: Nice little restaurant. It is small with only 5 tables and they fill up fast with reservations. I was able to secure one seat for myself on a Thursday night about 7pm. But she turned away everyone else that came in because of reservations. Nice assortment of menu items. I was searching for fish & chips to eat and they had it. This was very good. Wine and cocktail selection is great. Beer selection was very small. Staff was exceedingly friendly. It was like I was eating in her own house. Fun place.

6UxuOMVf1ZTIqmiwsSIbXA.text: Such a quaint cute restaurant with candles throughout. Ffiona is the owner and was there the night we went. She was so sweet! I had the chicken kiev and it was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

1Rj0FwdAnJrMztAAFm8PHQ.text: I came here for dinner with my parents on our last night in London and we were not disappointed. The food was lovely and the service was excellent. I had the vegetarian soup and the fish and chips and they were all delicious. My favorite was the sticky toffee pudding which was the perfect way to end our meal. Can't wait to come back to this place when I'm in London again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

udDVsCrxIHydE5PgtjT5yQ.text: Lovely restaurant that I enjoyed with my daughter at the beginning of our sprint through Europe. We traipsed through Buckingham Palace earlier - wouldn't turn down a meal there, but the home folks seem pretty uptight.Not so at Ffiona's and the smashing people and food. Our charming server Fatima and the owner's very helpful sister took lovely care of us. The chicken Kiev and roast lamb were delish and the variety of veggies was the bomb. We finished with Blueberry crumble and we're off to Paris. Is there anything to eat there?

gY1clPthyE26yoXzeun99w.text: There really are few times when we eat out and walk away better than we were when we walked in.  Last night was one of those exceptions. The restaurant is a very cozy and intimate dining area whose street front appearance belies the experience that awaits inside. While there is a printed drink menu, the food menu is written on a quaint chalkboard but be sure to ask about the daily specials! We almost missed out on the two outstanding starters - one, an incredible squid dish in a spicy  salsa-like tomato base with a garnish of fried squid on top, and, as improbable as it may sound, an incredible grilled mango with mushrooms dressed in warm balsamic vinegar. Because it is such a throwback menu item, and based on the feedback from our server, we ordered the chicken kiev and the parmesan salad.  Both were extraordinary.And when in London, you mus simply try the sticky toffee pudding which is served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and plenty of warm sauce. We were doing ou happy dance in our heads!But perhaps what may have been the icing on the cake was the opportunity to meet Ffiona, hear her story, and gain a better understanding of her craft and craftsmanship. All in all a special and memorable dining experience. Though we don't often choose to return to restaurants when we travel (because there are just so many to try!), we absolutely will go back and will recommend visitors try it as well!

JRB4d58YTct7m1tRXV49wA.text: Great food, Great service, Great atmosphere. The two waitresses were exceptionally polite and the food was very well proportioned and prepared. I would recommend the Chicken Kiev and the Toffee.

vMUaN8TOQpQxyqTmBENuuw.text: I love seafood but after reading so many great reviews about Ffiona's chicken Kiev, I said to my self, well let me give it a try. First try and It was a win win situation. Will definately be coming back for more of this. Yum yum

pg0Ek8G6Qx4SXmRPfsNDqQ.text: Charming restaurant, but warm since there was no a/c on! The restaurant has a nice selection of meal options and lots of interesting, but familiar items to choose from. It was hard to selection my main course. She had this avocado appetizer that was just scrumptious and lots of amazing side dishes that were just fabulous! My main dish was fish and it too was spectacular. I would definitely go back. There were lots of regulars there and the place is hopping!

eX2uonF7iw4d5ocd0DzLtw.text: In my 63 years, this is simply the best dinner I have ever had. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Ffiona greeted us with only what I can describe as welcoming us to her home. Her enthusiasm as she described the evening's offerings was contagious. My son, daughter in law and two grandchildren chose different entrees so to get a good variety. We started with prawns, salad and squid appetizers. Fabulous! Then we chose fish & chips, the lamb, duck and marvelous pork chop. All were cooked to perfection and melt in your mouth delicious. Will definitely return for another visit before we leave town. I already miss it!! Seriously, you need to check Ffiona's our. You won't be sorry. It would be wise to call ahead for seating although not required.  Ffiona, Marie and Fatima - we will be back! Thank you for an exceptional evening.

sLq7377Ip5NJyxJWqESSqg.text: They say British Cusine can be mediocre but Ffiona proved that wrong. The menu here can suit anyone's needs be it carnivores, vegetarians, and vegans. Ffiona herself was incredibly friendly getting to know each table being served and recommending dishes that'd best fit your appetite. I had the lamb and my friend being a vegetarian ordered the sweet potatoe noodles. The lamb was incredible. I loved each piece and the mashed potatoes served on the side were also delicous. My friend enjoyed his meal a lot, his favorite vegetarian meal he had in London. Their cocktails were nice and the wine selection is also pretty good and pairs well with the meals. If wanting to come here for dinner, I recommend making a reservation before since they can get pretty full! Great place that I'd definitely come back to once I visit London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The noodles
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The lamb

N0Tdp9qwahL-NrOe0ZKWHQ.text: This little place is AMAZING! Seriously, this is the place to visit when in London. I had the Queen scramble and my goodness it was so delicious. I was feeling a little crazy so I also ordered the French toast. Please you guys need to try the French toast. Never in my life have I ever had anything so good! The fruit was fresh and sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

33Iy9p7jBgJQ_an-cr5kOA.text: Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The fish and chips were great. It's just a little expensive. The atmosphere was good. It's a very home style restaurant. Like I said, everything was good, it's just a little over priced I think. I would recommend it though.

DhAnsnaT5q9jQEE_OuQTqQ.text: Best meal you'll have in London, hands down. We had the parmesan salad, scallops, chicken kiev, roasted carrots, and chips. Cannot wait to go back.

8XQb1dYt0Qw5gCGnJEfWzw.text: You won't find friendlier servers anywhere.  Really down to earth, making us feel at home. They even understand "American!" Place is very popular and crowded. We came for brunch and couldn't have been happier with the quality and quantity of the food.Prices are reasonable, and the conversations priceless. Our first time to London and so happy we found this jewel.Did I mention the food was great!To all of our American friends, don't miss this fabulous restaurant.

udtJS3O7zjSW3Vyio7ULnw.text: Our first night in London could not have been nicer! Fiona greeted us as family. My Pims Cup was made to perfection garnished with a perfectly sliced cucumber. We had lamb and a Chicken Kiev as entries. Her soup was vegetable using chicken stock and a highlight of the meal. Book reservations early since she sold out well before we arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

8kXUjhf6rKKJ7f_DK_5MFg.text: Great place owned by Fiona.  The food was delicious.  Chicken kiev was very juicy, and I enjoyed their duck pate.  Prices are also pretty reasonable for a Friday date kind of place.  Atmosphere is cozy and inviting.  Fiona herself is very friendly and will make sure to strike a conversation with you before you leave.  Overall, a lovely experience.

bY-Clcj-8icA4Y1vdKeCeg.text: As an avid yelper I had to come here based on the rave reviews that this place has. Luckily I happened to be in the area that day, and even more luckily we found a spot as a walk in. The décor is absolutely charming and very homey - what one would expect of a cute, small, family-run European bistro. The menu was well thought-out with an appropriate amount of options. Price.... well, while everything in London is expensive to a Canadian, I still found Ffiona's too be on the expensive end for food of comparable quality in London. I had the seared lamb - a fairly small piece of meat for 24 quid, that tasted slightly above-average at best. My friend had the home-made fishcakes, which were much more impressive as the fish was fresh and tender, and the cakes were battered and fried perfectly. Fiona herself was, of course, charming, but overall compared to the excellent dining scene in London and with respect to price vs. quality, I would not return despite a pleasant experience.

VkiQ9N78_Mj_MVd3lXywkg.text: It is like home cooked food with a twist of good side dishes. Very tasty side dishes . Better than the sirloin. If you go here go for the fish or the duck. Side dishes are all good but coctails are not so much. Rose wine was sparling and any sparkling wine is not real wine. Go for the starters, side dishes and fish. They are all very tasty. Cosy little place and it is not cheap. Very warm owner, nice people.

46gpMc1ZelPAkNB_ViMKQQ.text: Wonderful spot for a great Sunday Roast. I recommend making reservation & order their roast quickly as it goes fast. Wonderful service & great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Prawn & grilled avocado appetizer prior to our our Sunday pot roast.

0_NrUYBKGO03ymY017mckA.text: Yelp reviews did not steer us wrong on this one! Called ahead and talked to Fiona and got in no problem at 7pm on a Friday for 2 of us. Service was great and personal and we ended up ordering exactly what was recommended - smoked avocado to start, then chicken Kiev and fish pie to split for dinner. Could've maybe done without the greens but both entrees were incredible. Not misleading that their menu says it's the best chicken Kiev in the world!

tZqs7LfY-eZ5vRHgtLmtHg.text: This small charming cafe is one of those places that you will never forget! All of the food we had was top notch and unique. The service was delightful. The atmosphere heavenly if you like dark romantic spots. I highly recommend making a reservation since there are only a few tables. Our bill for three dinners plus wine and dessert was only 100 British pounds which we thought was reasonable.I really enjoyed the spiraled zucchini and sea scallops!!! I am from the US but traveled widely so trust me, this place is definitely worth checking out! The food photos do not do it justice.PS This place does not require formal attire. Down to earth.

zqCT0jXvgb95Z4IsKsh2tw.text: The menu is relatively small ( not a Chinese menu ) and that seems very smart to me. It still offers something for every taste however. We had the duck pate, lamb, fish, chicken Kiev and more and were blown away about the quality of every dish.  Staff and ambiance are top notch and I would highly recommend this place. Loved it.

japDDeeMbUP5lDyCQbBhZA.text: I came here over the weekend for brunch on a recommendation of a friend that lives in the neighbourhood. This place is a homely establishment in what is typically a rather pretentious part of town, and it's refreshing to find that these types of place still exist. I wanted the sweet potato and chorizo hash, but they had run out of it, so I got the vegan breakfast bowl instead and added two poached eggs on the side. It was rather salad-y and I had hoped it would be more quinoa and less kale. My friend had the queen scramble and was very pleased with it. The dishes seem reasonably priced, the décor feels like someone's home, and the person who served us (probably Ffiona herself) was very motherly and endearing. I wouldn't quite say the food lives up to the billing of "best brunch in London," as they claim on the website, nor would I say it's worth traveling across London for, but it's a very comforting, low key place that is great to have in the neighbourhood.

Osi7PspthfOiL_zFZOahuw.text: My very first brunch in London, so of course, I had to order the Full English Breakfast complete with English breakfast tea.  The dish consisted of tomatoes, fried eggs (can do scrambled or boiled as well), sausage, chips, bacons (NOT American style), and "black pudding."  Overall, I can't say I loved it, but perhaps, I have yet to get used to the British brunch (as opposed to the American/NYC brunch).The better part of the brunch was the ambience and the owner (?) lady.  The restaurant was cozy and quirky; it really made me feel like I had stepped into a local Brit's small cottage for a hearty brunch.  The owner lady was very jolly and kind to explain some of the dishes to us Americans.  Really felt like she cared about her business and the customers she served.

YVzGDoGM1IC-ZqaIn-P5PQ.text: Amazing Lunch! We had 2 bloody Mary's on the 2 for the price of one and the fish n chips.  All of it was excellent. The service made you feel like you needed to stay all day, so friendly. The portions were large and the drinks were delicious.  Small place, so if your going for dinner make a reservations. Go enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

p86DQ60_q5NsvKQGg6sA-Q.text: Excellent food in a homey little place just off the high street in Kensington. As others have noted, Ffiona is delightful. The fish cakes and Welsh lamb were excellent, particularly the latter. A welcome respite from the usual chains.

vmkmtMNLnBtUd2LAI3IQ3Q.text: Lovely experience. Great place, great food, family like atmosphere. If you want to enjoy a delicious and large english breakfast then this place is a must. It's a good idea to make a reservation as it gets packed for brunch.

Uu7DWOqtWlXZJZVV46mo-A.text: Simply phenomenal.  Upon asking the hotel concierge for a recommendation for local cuisine, I was immediately told to go to Ffiona's.  Upon entering the quaint restaurant, I was given a very warm welcome by Ffiona herself and shown to my table.  I told Ffiona that I was looking for authentic British fare and she took over from there.  After highlighting the specials, I was  easily convinced to order the fish cake as a starter and the meat pie as my entrée.  Both meals were exceptional.  With barely any room left, for dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream.  Wow!  Ffiona and her staff checked on me several times throughout the meal.  This clearly is a special spot that I would recommend without hesitation to anyone looking for a delicious, authentic and homemade meal.  Thank you Ffiona.

AV3z-uqRfDKRcY5C1Gv7Vg.text: Absolutely fantastic! Ffiona's has a warm, cozy atmosphere with delicious food.A couple of girlfriends and I booked on a Friday night With high expectations due to all the rave reviews. We were not disappointed!We happened to sit down as a large group of 20 arrived. In most establishments this would have effected the service but on the contrary, the service was absolutely top notch. I had a dirty martini which was perfect, and the table shared a bottle of house red which was quite nice. We started with the Moroccan  aubergine served with fresh mint and yoghurt dressing which was very flavourful and fresh baked bread.I ordered the Ffiona's fab  fish pie which was whipped and light. (Absolutely 5 star dish). The table also had the 8 oz Scottish sirloin steak and a chicken pie which were both delicious.Our desserts were phenomenal! The sticky toffee pudding was over the top! You must try it and we also had the cheesecake which was also good.I will definitely be returning again.

2PHcXaJVlFje467IsEuv3w.text: Ffiona's was probably the best meal we ate in London, and definitely gave us the best overall experience! Dining at Ffiona's was like having a meal with a friend (who just happens to own a fabulous restaurant!).  I cannot say enough good things about this place and its namesake!Ffiona herself was very welcoming and friendly, gave food and drink recommendations (take her recommendations, she will not steer you wrong!), made conversation with us and even brought out a cake when she learned both of our birthdays fell during our trip to London! Her level of hospitality went beyond anything else we've experienced! Even the other patrons were warm and welcoming and we stayed much longer than we intended to while chatting with the people next to us and Ffiona. Besides being a fabulous hostess, Ffiona's food is to die for! I started with the kale salad (with quinoa, edamame, cranberries, avocado and sunflower seeds with a mango, basil and tahini dressing), which was Ffiona's recommendation. It was delicious and paired well with the cocktail she recommended. I am still talking about that amazing salad! For our main dishes, I had a chicken dish and my husband had the lamb.  Everything was so good, there was a lot of plate sharing going on! I highly recommend Ffiona's and will no doubt be back next time we're in London!

a4TVd3pkOK3gIuqWisr6aA.text: What a gem! Our daughter found Ffiona's on yelp as we were wrapping up a full day of sightseeing. Much to our surprise we were able to get a table for 4. So happy they could fit us in at the last minute. It's not a big place so call ahead for reservations. We were fortunate and, after eating there, would have missed out on something really special. The food was phenomenal, service great and the atmosphere buzzing. One of our best nights in London.

aPR0p57579a5U0tGm6Mirw.text: Great, attentive service- Ffiona made the experience feel like we were the only customers there (the place was full). Food was super fresh and delicious, truly one of the best brunch spots in London! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a yummy breakfast in a cute, cozy setting

t1JU8DhBs8-4W1_lsezU0Q.text: Last meal-worthy food, and this is coming from a food-lover who's been in Asia, LA, NY. It takes a special touch to elevate comfort food classics and Ffiona's has it! My friend and I came here at the end of our first trip to London, and I couldn't think of a better goodbye meal! I had the chicken and leek pie with mashed potatoes. Creamy, savory, not-too-salty sauce with hearty shreds of white chicken, soft bits of leek, and topped with delicious puff pastry went perfectly with the buttery mashed potatoes. The flavors just had that perfect home-cooked taste that you wish your mother's had ;). My friend had the fish and chips with mushy peas and found her dish amazing as well. We both were extremely full but had to save room for sticky toffee pudding and ice cream and we're so glad we did. Fiona herself was just so warm and lovely, I felt like I was visiting the home of a good friend. She sat right down at our table to take our orders and was so sweet and welcoming. I would return to London just to try the rest of the menu!

ADaRFROrPh6K66j32Dxjng.text: Incredible!  Everything about it.  Perfect, small, cozy and friendly atmosphere. Very welcoming proprietor (Ffiona, herself) and wonderfully pleasant staff.  Food is superb. Had pork chops with amazing wine reduction; chicken Kiev - outstanding and the sticky pudding, not to be missed.  This is a quaint and beautiful spot not to be missed when in London.

aN-sbxbQJHKoiih1v5Qy9w.text: Freaking fabulous. Any negative comments are just plain wrong. The chicken and leek pie, the chicken Kiev, and the pork chop. The bread and butter pudding. Ffiona's sets the bar way too high for other restaurants in the vicinity. We are here for the weekend, and arguing about whether or not we should eat here every day!

Rxi76gWX0ZI2H1dK34_wMg.text: What an adorable & delicious spot. We walked in off the street, not realizing reservations were the norm. We should have known, considering the perfect 5-star rating on Yelp that drew us in in the first place. We were disappointed and almost turned to leave, when Fiona herself said there was a gap in reservations and if we could eat and be done in 1.5 hours, the table was ours! Easy! So we did. I ordered the fish & chips, and my wife ordered the chicken kiev. Both were such simple dishes and we didn't expect to be blown away - and yet! We both left our plates so clean the dishwasher may have wondered if they had even been used. We also had the Parmesan salad, which again, was amazingly simple but supreme. My pregnant wife also loved her elderflower mocktail. It was one of those meals where you aren't let down by even one thing - and so, Fiona's 5-star rating is obviously earned and well deserved. Fiona herself stopped by our table for a chat, and we couldn't be happier to be supporting her business. Such a lovely, genuine person. If you're in the area, make sure you make this one of your stops. We stayed in Kensington for 9 days and ate our way through the entire area. This was by far the best and most memorable meal of them all! Thanks again Fiona!

Wu7azyhlhuQ_bnBksQkSiQ.text: Just wasn't impressed. The restaurant was small, but did not feel cozy, brightly lit, so not romantic. Food wasn't impressive. Service and management were excellent. Would not recommend.

6K7i1_pX1OhoIJD8fJMCBw.text: What a lovely place! It was our best dinner during the time in London. The food was lovely and the staff very friendly. You have to try the Sticky Toffee Pudding! We'll definitely come back during our next stay.

yYcUmm3V7WlqNczScNsvsg.text: What a marvelous place.  The food is excellent and Ffiona is such a gregarious and creative cook.  This is simply one of my favorites in London.  Fish and chips was delightful and the lamb superb.  Great list of sides and a varied menu featuring fresh ingredients in season.This is a good place for family, friends, or couples.  It is on the smallish side so I recommend that you call ahead for a reservation or drop Fiona an email.The location is Kensington with a simple storefront.  It was not too far from public transportation.Loved talking to Fiona and her staff.  This is a gem and worth the trip to dine there.

i7rbxE6bxTA5NMWwuUuPUw.text: Really excellent dining experience.  Wonderful fish and chips.Small venue, good idea to have reservations.Broad menu that changes daily and super friendly, fun staff.

yVGVzoljNVu5n14Lu9L6qA.text: VIBE: Super comfortable inviting restaurant with delicious homey food.FOOD:Grilled avacado - yummy, the pesto sauce that came with it was really goodFish & chips - fish was super good, crunchy on the out side and the fish was perfectly cooked. However I was not a fan of the thick dense fries.Chocolate cheese cake - not good, it taste grainy with a weird texture. I only ate the ice cream.Toffee cake - good, but really strong toffee flavor. If u don't like toffee or strong flavors in general I would avoid this.

se9mDvznmX7cvmZBrY13TQ.text: You want the best food in London go to Ffionas. The owner is wonderful and runs the restaurant on the floor. The food is to die for. Especially the Toffee Pudding, holy moly!!! Like last meal type good. A lot of locals come and it's a real home type feel. Catch the music on the ceilings it's pretty awesome. Don't miss this delicious meal in London, I promise you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips delicious. Next time can't wait to try the world famous Chicken Kiev
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Toffee Pudding (yum.com)

Ta0xY4ddk-rwVAEHGoBjtw.text: Fellow Yelpers are spot on. We liked Ffiona's so much we went back two days later. Tiny space belies breadth of culinary skill. The food is farm to table, but the skill with which it is cooked provides the diner with something that is so much more. Fresh Dover scallops on a purée of local dark greens - wonderful. Cornish hake - delicious. Scottish sirloin - to die for. Apple and blueberry crumble with custard - just about over the top. Don't pass this up!

I3JECoUCgH6qa5fPFEEfLg.text: As I begin this review I'm trying my best to do Ffiona's's the credit it deserves for the dining experience my girlfriend and I just had but I know nothing I can write can even come close. The owner is probably the nicest woman I've ever met. We had the vegetable soup, beat noodles (12/10), chicken and leeks and the fish. Everything was absolutely amazing. So good we are headed for brunch on Saturday or Sunday of this week . This restaurant should have 6 out of 5 stars.This was a meal we will never forget

IjDaXCK-0v0XdOMxXRdENQ.text: A great little place not far from Kensington Palace. Warm, cozy and inviting. After reading the reviews I had to try it before dashing off to the airport. They open at 6pm, so I called at 5:30, said I was one, and it was no problem. I was the first person in the door and was welcomed and seated and we got started right away. Fiona explained the menu with gusto and a no-nonsense confidence. I started with the fig and goat cheese salad. Light, tasty, beautifully dressed. Next I opted for the famous Chicken Kiev, which was perfectlyexecuted. The chicken was fried perfectly, juicy on the inside, with a beautiful garlic butter sauce oozing out from the inside. Did have room for dessert.Don't miss it if you are in the area. Make sure you book, this place is hot!

EjVHpDikpet69EFlzPKnjQ.text: Ffiona's is simply one of those restaurants that makes you question all of your previous five star ratings. I had the pleasure of visiting this charming little British restaurant last week for a team dinner with a handful of coworkers and I think most of us agreed it was one of our best meals in London. The lights were low, the walls covered in sheet music and not a menu in sight--other than what was scribbled on the back wall in chalk.  I ordered the Rump of Welsh Lamb and it was without a doubt the best lamb I've ever. It was impossibly tender and there was a thick salty crust that made it perfect just on it's own. However, for those that aren't purists, there were two sauces served with the lamb, a sweet chutney and a mint sauce that surprisingly took the dish to a whole new level. The drinks were not anything special for me, but still well executed. For dessert, I finally got my long-awaited sticky toffee pudding! Toffee is one of my favorite sweets and this one was everything I hoped for and more. Richer and stickier than what I've experienced in the U.S., this toffee sauce clung tightly to the moist sponge cake beneath it. It was topped with vanilla ice cream which was a nice subtle sweetness to cut the intense toffee flavor.  The service was excellent all around. Our waitress (Fiona herself!) even comped one of our bottles of wine as a apology for having to sit next to an extra rowdy (read: drunk) group for the entire night. If you're in Kensington, or elsewhere in London and up for a commute, this is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Rump of Welsh Lamb
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Bourbon Cocktail
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Green Salad with Parmesan

9R72OgTxjboazIha6ck8dg.text: Ordered duck, lamp and fish and chips. it turned out that the fish and chips are the best out of the three. lamp was OK. The amount of food per order is not a lot, so be prepared to order more if you are in hunger!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. so so.
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. lamp, not bad
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. fish and chips. yummy

5Sanmq3zwAip9TwJWawD-Q.text: A gem of a restaurant. Truly what you look for in a small time, big delivery restaurant. Fresh ingredients, lively atmosphere and Ffiona herself waiting tables provide a phenomenal experience that you're not soon to forget. We complimented the chef and Marie came out to thank us humbly and we couldn't find enough words to let her know how much we enjoyed our dinner.

3g1PTuDmS6_nyFXnoDTRcA.text: Food 5 // Ambiance 5 // Service 5 This place was on my eye from the second I stepped into London. This is a tiny little spot so definitely reserve well ahead of time! Luckily, since I was a solo traveller, I was seated promptly. The owner of the restaurant is not only cooking and serving, but adding her flair to the ambiance of Ffiona's. She embodies the restaurant and you can see her love and passion in the food, decor, and warmth of the restaurant. The food was simple, delicious and fresh! The drinks menu was quite unique. I got a lychee and prosecco drink -- so refreshing! ALSO GET THE STICKY TOFFEE -- the best I have ever had!

HBzTVnkK3DbL7mhLbFboSA.text: Excellent brunch spot - definitely book in advance. Portions are massive and delicious, and the staff was cheeky and fun. They do a Full English - veggie or non, plus heaps of eggs dishes, plenty of great side options like halloumi or bacon, and the pancakes looked nice. And we had a lovely glass of pink prosecco, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The (veggie) Full English

IxzFWeaSRhYAOvPH4Clqiw.text: You must get a reservation for brunch. This place is packed! And good reason as the food is awesome! Great breakfast selections that have a mix of classics with Ffiona's originals. I loved my Queen's scramble since it had a great flavor profile. Savory, spicy and tangy! And the haloumi cheese was awesome too. Lots of great things happening here. Really cute place as well with friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

McjMly_sU-DCLOQCuzdcFg.text: My wife and I were looking for a special place to eat for our last evening in London. After a number of Yelp reviews and online searches, we narrowed the list of places down to just two. We were staying at the Royal Garden Hotel in Kensington, and wanted something within walking distance. After getting lost, we hailed a Black Cab and said "please take us to Ffiona's on Church Street. We're starving!"Ffiona's is one of those little gems that you read about, but rarely have the privilege of actually coming across. The restaurant is small, cozy, and welcoming. We were greeted at the door by a very friendly waitress who showed us to one end of two of their community style dining tables. There are other tables that seat smaller parties but they were full.After ordering our meal, my wife quickly identified the owner, a friendly, affable, take-charge woman who was frequently chatting with a number of the other guests, many of whom appeared to be neighborhood regulars.The meal itself was excellent. I had the Scottish Sirloin Steak with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and roasted carrots. Exactly the type of no-nonsense meal that I was looking for. My wife ordered the Scallops and thoroughly enjoyed them.During our meal, Ffiona came by our table to check on us, which gave my wife, who also owns a restaurant in Los Angeles, an opportunity to strike up a conversation. They ended up chatting for 20 minutes about the restaurant business. We feel like we've made a new friend.All in all, we had a fantastic experience. The atmosphere was cozy, the owner and staff were friendly and attentive, the prices were very reasonable, and the value was over the top. Our favorite meal of our entire trip.We will definitely be back on our next trip to the UK!

erf8uO5XDvmfCElsMz7Ueg.text: If you know Kensington, you know Ffiona's, and there's a good reason for that. Right up front here I need to give Ffiona's recognition for embracing Yelp and adding functionality like being able to contact and quickly hear back from Ffiona's wholly within the app - brilliant. I know Yelp can be extremely frustrating for many business owners, but Ffiona, who is a true gem of a human and big part of why Ffiona's is so appealing, has really embraced the interface in a positive way. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?What more could you ask for? Quaint and authentic, a meal at Ffiona's honestly feels as though you're a guest at here house, with standard dining room table, chair, and cutlery options akin to what are likely in your own home in addition to a simple menu and specials that will cover all the favorites. It's worth noting here that Ffiona herself is lovely in every way, and truly cares for each of her customers as if they were, again, a guest in her own home. Star Granted. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?Ffiona's isn't what I would call cheap, but by Kensington standards she's right in line with the average price points more or less across the board. If I recall correctly my jalapeno scramble special was £15.00 or so with my side of sausage included, and while it wasn't a ton of food as you might be able to deduce from the picture, it was satisfying. Star Granted. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?Breakfast dishes are my favorite dishes, and Ffiona's dished up a good one. While a little bit runny as you also might be able to tell from the picture, my jalapeno scramble with mushrooms, some potatoes, and diced pickled jalapenos had really good flavor and went well atop the toast. I was hoping for a tad bit more than a single piece of sausage as my side, but that too was very good. Single Star Granted. Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?Next time my mother is in London I'm bringing her to Ffiona's first thing, and come to think of it there's no one I wouldn't bring to Ffiona's given the charm, the atmosphere, the menu, value, and quality. Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Jalapeno Breakfast Special: 15.00

S-xlpb2wHUNNgY1hbEVzWw.text: Great restaurant with friendly staff. Try the fish and chips. However the steak with garlic butter was one of the best steaks I've ever had. A sticky toffee for dessert is a great finisher along with "the mess" which is a strawberry sundae with whip cream it is amazing and should be eaten by everyone.

GFlWLd2yIde4TLhDBSLinw.text: Excellent. We stopped by here for dinner after arriving at our hotel. Happy this was our first meal in London.  I had house wine and chicken Kiev. They mistakenly brought me the chicken roast and at the moment I thought "huh this must be what I ordered" and started eating.  A few minutes later the waitress realized the mix up and bought me the kiev anyway. Both dishes were amazing and I finished both entrees . My friend ordered fish and chips with a soup starter and cocktail. Again all excellent.  At this point we were stuffed but had to order dessert. We got the sticky toffee pudding and fresh strawberry cream dish. Both had us drooling. We definitely overt ate and will be back for another visit before we leave the city.

dYGoaMxw12xoOtIGZg6gLw.text: I  it. My first here. My husband found this restaurant on Yelp, he recommended it to me. I'm glad I went. I had greens and grilled prawns. I enjoyed every bite. Ffiona is very warm and welcoming. I will definitely go back someday.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Awesomeness

Cxi9mFollwdUrc6S0uJyng.text: It was just a great home-cooked meal but out in a restaurant. Simple but delicious food: roast lamb with great sauce, field carrots and colcanon

8exF4WhIJTDmzejDfdRcZQ.text: This place is fantastic. It is a wonderful place because there is a good atmosphere and tasty dishes are served. This place relaxes me with a magic design: many clocks, flowers, books and  others nice details.When I want to be alone, it is  the perfect place. I like to order in this restaurant a Latte  and Prawn&grilles avocado - these are very delicious. I'm in love with this place!

Z4bCtRfMJ3zQO7k65QRoqQ.text: We had a lovely dinner here for our last night in London. As soon as you step in, it feels like you're eating at a friend's house. My husband ate the Chicken Kiev (delicious!) and I had the traditional fish 'n chips. Everything was so delicious and fresh, and reasonably priced. This is a definite must!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Traditional fish 'n Homemade Traditional Fish And Chips , Tartare Sauce And Mushy Peas

dKXvLF-e0Q-zfKj0v_6vVA.text: I reserve 5 star Yelp reviews for those restaurants I would not hesitate to recommend or to go back to if given a chance.  My mother ate here twice in four days last year and recommended it to our family during our vacation to London this year.  We saved this meal for our last night and we all truly wish we would have eaten here earlier in the week just so we could eat there again!  The table next to us liked their meal so much that they made reservations for the following night.   It is not a big place and it is only open 6pm-11pm - reservations are highly recommended/required. It is also not good for groups.  Anything more than a party of 6 might have an issue getting a table.The food?  The menu says "Probably the best Chicken KIev in the world" and it is right.  If there is a better serving of this dish, I haven't had it.  Perfectly cooked chicken served in a sauce that deserves to be sopped up with bread.  Note that none of the entrees came with sides, so we recommend the chips (aka fries) and the spicy butternut squash.  My step-sons had the scottish sirloin steak and the swordfish.  My daughter had the homemade vegetable soup and avocado and pesto salad.  The desserts did not disappoint either: sticky toffee pudding, apple crumble and something I think called an Eaton - it was a meringue with strawberries.The are quite a few mixed cocktails - and mocktails for the alcohol-adverse.One of the highlights of the meal was the interaction with the owner and restaurant namesake: Ffiona.  FFiona splits time between the kitchen and the dining room.  She truly cares for each meal and diner.I can see why there are currently 175 Yelp reviews with a neat perfect rating.

AqqwqmWW41kcQXm0UmOGEQ.text: I don't get the hype. Maybe we ordered the wrong items. We ate here for brunch and found it to be lackluster at best. Boring, overpriced french toast, and some bland, dry, fried chicken dish that tasted like it could have come from a fast food joint. This was not great food and not worth the wait.

mJn1-vwf72zbu_OF9jUrWA.text: Exceptional restaurant with outstanding food and great, neighborhood feel.  Fun, excellent service with personality.  We had a duck pate appetizer, homemade, delicious, very good cocktails--a Negroni and a Pimms with cucumber and fruit, the spectacular veal chop and a swordfish with a homemade green spicy mayo that might have been better.  Outstanding sauces, perfectly cooked food, great neighborhood atmosphere and, for London, moderate price.  Can't ask for more!

2m3n0sIraMJhD0GvPNgKNQ.text: great services, pricy but decent food. order eggs royal, French toast for brunch on Sunday. The eggs royal is well made, the French toast is average. it is a busy place, most people already had reservation, we were just lucky to get a table. service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. eggs royal
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. French toast
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

X6PoMliRy4nVLHcIUiy5sA.text: Delicious food.  Wonderfully personalized services. Charming atmosphere.  I spent a week in the London area and this was probably best restaurant experience I had during my time.We came in on a weeknight and were able to be seated immediately.  After a few minutes we were greeted with a sweet lady that sat down beside us and explained the menu and some of her favorite items.  We ended up going with a few cocktails, pate and chicken noodle soup to start, and the lamb roast as our entree.  Everything was delicious.  The soup and pate in particular was extremely flavorful and balanced.  We didn't have time for desert as we were running late but looking around, don't think we would have been disappointed.  PS: Expect European paced service on the check if you're running on a schedule!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Homemade chicken noodle soup and pate to start!

svFFsavtehKkxQu6K8ishQ.text: Found Ffiona's through Yelp. We were lucky that it was less than a mile from our hotel. Decided to eat here on our last night in London and we were not disappointed. Made a reservation for 7:00 pm on a Thursday and it was pretty empty when we came. We ordered the scallops, king prawns, vegetable soup, pork chops, chicken kiev and sticky toffee pudding. Everything was delicious! My daughter loved the king prawns! Service was nice and fast. The servers were friendly. The place was homey and casual yet elegant at the same time. I recommend this place to anyone wanting a delicious and satisfying meal.

_8wG1QgiDDctlwx-QuFtig.text: Wonderful place. Food was delicious and server's recommendations were wonderful. Outstanding squid entree was very tender and had a nice little kick from the chilies. Chicken Kiev was certainly the best I've ever had with savoury sauce and perfectly crispy breading. Calcanon and steamed greens were perfect accompaniment. All served promptly and steaming hot. Portions were generous - couldn't finish it all. Had to try the lemon mascarpone cheesecake for dessert, which didn't disappoint. Cozy bistro location, good for couples, business and saw a few families. Will definitely make a point of returning next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

wPWRUA_9IlT8qW73QDuxzg.text: I wasn't expecting Ffiona's to live up to the incredible reviews I see here, but I was pleasantly surprised. I showed up alone, without a reservation but Fiona (is her name really spelled with two ffs? I forgot to ask) graciously found me a seat at a large (communal?) table. the space is pretty small, but the tables are spaced out pretty well so it's intimate but you don't feel like you're sharing your meal with people at the next table. I think there is the one large table which is probably used for walk-ins.the menu is written on a big chalkboard. I think there are some daily specials as well as the standard fare. I opted for the grilled avocado which was fantastic. I doubt I would go back and not order it every time. for main they had duck breast that night which was superb.wine list was not extensive, but enough options, and fairly priced.but the best part of the experience is the atmosphere. it's so cozy and inviting and on the night I was there, Fiona was chatting with the customers in a way that made everyone feel like they were friends. she came to my table and talked with me for a while too, which was really nice.I come to London quite frequently these days and Ffiona's will definitely be on my regular rrotation :)

9TNElJx3S83ut6bLgE9EvQ.text: Fantastic food in a quaint atmosphere. Definitely recommend if you're in the area. Brunch menu was great, with delicious drinks. Gluten free options as well!

1x7NtCUQZVtG-ebUnUNlDg.text: Busy. Wonderful staff and owner involved, which is a good thing. Scallops were very good. Service was excellent. Love the owner Ffiona.

NjNpIuc2L6e9FboQf8akfg.text: One of our favorite meals of our recent trip to London.From the moment we walked in we felt like we were at a friends house  for dinner. Outstanding food. We had the Lamb and Fish and chips.Both were some of the best ever. Ffiona the owner was present and really made a great effort to make our evening memorable.Also our server a young lady from Portugal (I'm sorry I didn't get her name) was great.I can see why shes been in business for 25 years. Great job !!

pdoKxCQ3-7tC2Ydy1LONwA.text: I had one day in London and I decided to spend the only meal I had time to eat here. After a long day of pounding pavement, the last thing I wanted to do on a Friday night was to fight for a table at a loud pub. Ffiona's was a delightful gem in the middle of a bustling city. Ffiona actually greeted us when we walked through the door. The ambiance was beautiful with candlelight, chalkboard menus and sheet music wallpaper. I had the fish and chips, my first London meal. And, my mom had the peppercorn steak. We shared sides of spicy butternut squash and steamed greens. Everything was fulfilling and delicious. My favorite food parts of this place were the mushy peas and the greens. What comfort food! Although the food was fantastic, my overall favorite part of this trip was Ffiona. She sat with patrons as they ate as if she'd know them for years when in fact they only stopped in moments before. Some she actually has known for years. You couldn't tell the difference. For all I knew, I was at Ffiona's house as her friend. Her food was delicious, her personality was more than satisfying. I will return to Ffiona's again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Ffiona of Ffiona's. Such a wonderful woman!
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Lovely ambiance. Exactly what I needed at the end of a long, busy day.
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Peppercorn steak. I loved the texture and spice of the peppercorns. Tender, too.

D1zCTDCZNiwMBkmLnQvq3w.text: Our favorite meal after 5 days in London. Highly recommend making a reservation. We walked in without one and got lucky because someone had just cancelled. The place is small and intimate, warm and inviting. Ffiona is friendly, and you can tell the locals go here. We started with the King Prawns which were delicious and flavorful. The chicken kiev is amazing, one of the best things I've ever eaten. We also got the steak and kidney pie which did not disappoint. The mash and greens were great too. No complaints and would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a nice, hearty dinner in London.

eJYg3xUhPd0Ku-zLmkOrww.text: Exceptional....creative organic breakfast/brunch prepared with fresh ingredients like we' remember having at home.Ffiona runs a most wonderful restaurant; non in London compare...

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

q4dW62PtfhhMiEYyalPhRQ.text: Lovely atmosphere here and yummy comfort food and a nice wide menu choice. I go on Sunday's for a lazy lunch but you need to book in advance as it gets busy.

Up-S0-pKB25n7aSNpbOqaQ.text: What a cozy little place!  Food is really good!  Owner sits down with you and asks you what you would like.  Nice little cocktail list. Good wine list. Reasonable prices.  There is NOTHING here not to like!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

vfk3KMjnXr7IUpLOBOmmPQ.text: Love this cute little place! We came here on a beautiful Sunday morning for breakfast. The waitress was welcoming & quick to get us taken care of. The owner was there and she is just a peach! So sweet & attentive our entire sitting. Both ladies are just lovely & always made sure to check in on us. They genuinely care for their customers & service. We had the special of the day which was poached eggs w/ a homemade red hummus of some sort which was so delicious. Also the dish w/ eggs, sausage, bacon & 2 cafe lattes. Highly recommend Fiona's & hope to come back again one day :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

KpHE6hkF8psHuprqOF08kA.text: Wow....just wow! Between the familiar, homey service to the exquisitely fresh ingredients, Ffiona elevates traditional British dishes creating my most satisfying meal in London in the past 15 years.

Bj7jT2acUF7nKXwwFsojvg.text: Good portion and quality are all good. Not for tourists but for local people around. Definitely would come back again.

UH-8b9naoT2EMHSgMJhMYA.text: I was vacationing in London with my mother over my birthday, and wanted a nice place to celebrate my big 4-0.  Several friends recommended this restaurant, and wow, were they right.  An unassuming storefront hides a charming, cozy interior with pinewood tables and an intimate atmosphere.  Ffiona greeted us with a hug and a "Happy birthday" for me (I'd made a booking and mentioned my birthday) and told us about the fresh foods available that day.  I had what may have been the best cocktail I've ever had the - the English Country Garden (gin, elderflower, lemonade and crushed mind with cucumbers and orange slices) - and we ordered off the chalkboard menu.  I had lamb and my mother had roast pork - both were delicious.  I just wish I lived closer than 4000 miles away or I'd be at Ffiona's often!

Tfhi0ruN00M0MXgIvcJTFw.text: This is an amazing little place with a great authentic British menu. The flavors were absolutely INCREDIBLE and decent portions. The owner is extremely welcoming with a great sense of humor and wants to get to know all of her customers. It's a must!

XJFoHFtSMwyRZFLqWLftDg.text: I came here while on tour with Cris Cab in London.  We were looking for a casual vibe, cool environment with a variety of choices.  FFiona's was a gem... Walked in after a California cigarette to a homey but artsy vibe, old school eating, grandma housevive or your more nerdy conservative friend (book club hot mom vibe). The waitress was funny (later to find out it's Ffiona the owna) knew the dishes well, cussed as she spoke and really read the room and environment.  She loves her job and obviously loves to host and entertain.  It was a well needed escape.  All ingredients are as fresh as possible, healthy and organic.  The grilled avocado did change my life, I feel enlightened and glowing as if tonight will be an epic adventure due to the perfection in the flavor.  My colleagues all were in owe of there dishes.  We couldn't go wrong.  I ordered the fish specialty which was a fresh trout with a coconut lime sauce.  And she was nice enough to take off the skin (I think it's a texture thing).  If you are a touring band, in London area or a foodie.  It's worth it.  Love you Ffiona, next time dinners on me.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Trout yo ... Yummmmm

IDFAfUTn0ZIYcVWhOFUIMg.text: A London institution, not just the restaurant but the fine lady herself. Juicy prawns to die, halloumi to savour and a jovial, friendly atmosphere a world away from the clinical efficiency of a larger chain. Walking distance between High St Kensington and Notting Hill Gate, this is certainly a hidden gem of the West.so sssh!For a sneak peak inside the restaurant, and meet the woman herself:youtube.com/playlist?lis…

nfvdkiqu197J0gncGkia_g.text: Don't miss this place! The atmosphere and food at Ffiona's are fantastic. The restaurant is intimate and inviting. Ffiona spends time at every table making sure her patrons are well taken care of.  She is a big part of the charm of her restaurant, but she also serves delicious food. I wish I had a restaurant like this at home.

C1FxwM1dLvLu4xyVceuHBQ.text: Lovely english food. Snuck a bite of the fish pie from my man. Yum!! A bit rustic, a bit quirky, with ffiona's personal touch (she was serving herself). Will definitely go back. Not least because she now does Saturday brunch (10:00-15:00) and there's free cocktails! Completely decadent, i know, but maybe a virgin version is just healthy juice?

QQ-LYqxfsHcuW8nX4csA8A.text: Exceptional food in a cozy setting. Ffiona is an outstanding hostess who made me feel like I was having brunch with a friend. This place is not to be missed.

an08zwBxE2nUtKB-1KS9pw.text: I'm in London for a conference, and a colleague who used to live in Notting Hill made a reservation for four of us at Ffiona's. The entire experience was outstanding from start to finish. Ffiona herself welcomes you, tells you about the specials, and with the aid of her right hand, Tilly, serves you. I started with a salad of greens and fried Halloumi cheese. The cheese was so good that I shared it with my colleagues. For my entree I had the Chicken Kiev, which the menu -- on a chalkboard -- claims is the best in the world. I believe them. The chicken was done to perfection and the garlic, butter, and (some green veggie) stuffed in the middle were excellent. Dessert was sticky toffee pudding. I cleaned the plate. We also had a nice bottle of wine -- Barbera d'Alba Sucule 2006, Villa Lanata, Italy.The ambience was warm and inviting, and the location, a short walk from the Kensington Tube, was very convenient. The entire restaurant had a happy and friendly vibe. If you're on that side of London -- or even if you're not -- seek out Ffiona's. (I had a nice conversation with a large family, also from the U.S., who seemed to be enjoying the restaurant as much as I did.)

0gbsPcYlG2vRgT0zsveAJw.text: I would recommend if you are heading to Ffiona's Restaurant you should book beforehand. I had spaghetti bolognese and they were really yummy

c4jIuhoi5454cWCAkyj3dA.text: The first time I noticed ffionas restaurant on Church Street, i was walking briskly on my way to college. It was early morning and I glanced in a window to see five empty wine bottles, and a scattering of glasses on the table, it surprised me because it looked more like a lovely after-scene of a great party, casual and beautiful and ... welcoming. i thought.. oh, i must try that! The first time I ate at ffionas..several months later.. I found the impression I had that first morning was spot on. My date and I were warmly welcomed by Ffiona herself, regaled with tales of the mysterious goings on in the kitchen and firmly guided to menu choices that fulfilled our every secret desire. The steak was exceptional, perfectly cooked medium rare, the sauce Diane a revelation, served with a lovely soup of carrot corriander and pumpkin, a sexy tangy salad and sides of mash and asparagus spears with garlic so sumptuous it made me lightheaded. I live in Peru now ( the home of some amazing food as well!!) . but when I get a new volunteer in our house from London, as I often do, if they know Ffiona's? We are bosom pals.

y4jCew7mvMEWelh2ficP2A.text: How cute is this place?  Dark, moody lighting, sassy service, delicious food, this place has it all.  Ffiona - the owner - is passionate about what she does and passionate about her food.  The fish was fresh and tasty and the mashed potatoes with leeks were so good.  This is simple, clean tasting food with just enough exotic twists to keep it interesting and keep you coming back!

Mpu1PQp5wBdn5QeJhE4-hg.text: Ffiona's is one of my favorite restaurants in Kensington.  It's very small and intimate (great date choice), while the food is incredibly good - on the traditional side but not bland at all.  Ffiona (the owner) is everywhere - she has a funny habit of eavesdropping on tables and bringing out your drinks before you've actually ordered them!  Unlike most restaurants in the UK, they also have a decent weekend brunch selection (including waffles!)

3IlNHqd5XrTEGOMH4kq2Dg.text: Visited Ffiona's for an excellent brunch last weekend. It feels very 'neighbourhood' and I was taken by some Kensington locals. We had eggs, bacon and American pancakes with maple syrup. Everything was delicious and there was a very nice atmosphere there.

9nqvWc_DzBnbFUfpAfBvOA.text: So I honestly picked this place strictly based on Yelp (and Google) reviews. We were staying in Kensington near the palace so I wanted to find a restaurant close to our hotel for our first night in after travel. As you can obviously see, Ffiona's has great reviews. The location is a little bit off the main drag, but not too far. When we first got there, we were pretty surprised at the simple storefront and very small interior. Don't be fooled!Ffiona herself was there running the show as she has been for 20+ years. All of the menu items are written up on the chalk board. It's an extremely homey experience. We got a great bottle of red wine and just let Ffiona basically pick what we should order. My entire family loved their dishes. We had fish and chips, lamb, fish, everything. Overall very intimate experience. It's evident that Ffiona has been doing this for a long time and cares very much about each and every visitor having an amazing time.

UNwAlHNkV6nWSOyzsGRZ_g.text: Absolute gem! We were so happy when we called (last minute) for a reservation and got in. Down home cooking at a friendly budget and that takes your breath away! Ffiona was absolutely wonderful to us and we're a mixed couple of girls so I'm not sure about the complaints on discrimination. Word to the wise: listen to what is being offered, she means what she's saying if something is good or recommended. And, we're the travelers in her house so take it easy, enjoy some wine and order some delicious food, everything else will fall into place. We had so much fun we made a new friend for life. I'm so thrilled we decided to come in despite the few scary reviews. We ordered: half bottle of white wine, fizzy water, scallops for appetizer, chicken Kiev, an assortment of sides, the special seafood stew, and last but not least, sticky toffee pudding. Everything is a must order.

qBpbNAV2bDauresMeJgOiA.text: Happy Halloween was back October 7, 2018 for dinner and it was again World Class with that touch only Ffiona can do. Had a fabulous veal chop with an amazing mushroom sauce OMG. Of course I had the amazing soup so fresh and that organic Parmesan salad with Ffiona's own fabulous dressing Just tying it makes me salivate in anticipation of my next visit!!!Service was superb as usual and they got a new member of the family, she will fit right in so kind and genuine. All of what one would expect if there own mother was hosting a dinner. IF YOU HAVE NOT BEEN GO....... ITS NOT TO BE MISSED Ffiona's is not to be missed if your in London it's so wonderfully amazing your want to skip the tours and just have a relaxing world class supGoing tonight can't wait...24 October 2018 will update later or see y'all thereAnother fabulous supper that only Ffiona can do!Had the second famous fish stew freshly made to order served piping hot as only the worlds best restaurant can do cannot express my delight with her Fabulous Seafood Stew like no other........brimming with fresh seafood OMG I ALREADY WANT MORE.........Started with the super fresh organic Parmesan salad lightly topped with Ffiona's own House made salad dressing Then onto that seafood stew mouth is watering just thinking about it againCan't wait to get back to London next week for another visit Oh almost forgot the best part of tonight was the service better than at home........gonna have to bring my mother if I can get her on the planeTill next week.......

cp_rCnowZgZXlN2vf1_aqw.text: This was our first dinner in London and we did not regret it at all. We had curious beer and a mixed drink. We started with scallops and they were devoured and melted in your mouth. I ordered the lamb with mash and my husband ordered veal with butternut squash. The lamb was so delicate and paired well with the mash. The veal with mushroom sauce was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. Bread was served with butter as well.We also ordered the sticky toffee pudding with ice cream and mocha cake with whipped cream. It was a magnificent way to end dinner.We also ordered mint tea and a black coffee. The mint tea was real mint and it was perfect.The service matched the exquisite spot and we were served by Ffiona herself. What an awesome experience to meet the owner of the place. It is definitely a local and charming spot.

XWtAGhpfdRuSMs_O5l6oZQ.text: i was a great experience dining here, I came here with my family by chance, but it is really amazing restaurant, I think I'm so lucky to find it. I ordered lamp chop my father had steak and my brother had swordfish , waited a little bit long, but considering all the tables were full, it was understandable. All the dishes we ordered were tasty and unique in its own way. Enjoyed.Thx

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

MpZtKGNLymOysd94ivZXoQ.text: This was by far the best place I ate in London. Not only for the delicious food but also for the warm atmosphere. Fiona and her staff welcome you in their restaurant and make you feel right at home. Simply lovely people!  If you visit during Thanksgiving don't miss her traditional Thanksgiving dinner, "just like mom used to make!" The weekend brunch is wonderful as well. I had a bloody Mary which was fresh and perfectly spiced followed by a delectable full English breakfast. You do not want to miss Ffionas, her warm and generous spirit along with scrumptious meals in an intimate atmosphere make this spot just delightful!.

3WXS03JzIKk9BjOYd34AeQ.text: Let me start by saying this - if you have to wait to be seated, WAIT. Ffiona's is the most worth it place ever, and is run by Ffiona herself (who is the sweetest woman).  We were searching high and low for a local spot to have some good brunch... we hit the jackpot with this place. I would highly recommend the eggs Benedict and French Toast (which we ordered with the Waffle toppings). My boyfriend had the full English breakfast which he really enjoyed. It's a cozy, home style, lovely little place and once seated Ffiona and the other waitress are just wonderful. I wanted to order everything on the drink Menu, but we settled for the Machiatto and English breakfast tea. You can really tell a lot of hard work and love goes into this place - will be returning for dinner before the end of our trip!

r-Ocb_cYZ8EJovwA4ilFgA.text: The food here was awesome. Took my wife here for dinner after seeing the reviews on Yelp and it exceeded our expectations. My wife had the rump of welsh lamb, and it was delicious, probably the best I've ever had. I had there chicken kier which is probably the best in the world as they say. Last but not least, a must have dessert, sticky toffee pudding. It was amazing. The staff was so warm and welcoming.

zXaCoiEXMjnTP-rVZtoDnw.text: - strongly recommend making reservations as the place is small and popular, 12 or less tables, intimate, walk ins welcome (but likely a wait)- friendly staff - welsh lamb was cooked perfectly, well dressed and tender- sirloin steak w/ a side of new potatoes was comfortable; something you'd make at home but without the effort of having to cook it yourself - daily menu changes (written on a blackboard), - we just missed the last order of scallops but they looked amazing- will return during my next visit, would be a regular if I lived nearby- farm to table- apple berry crumble and eton mess were both enjoyable

IlhPcqBMvKYK_jTU15bT_Q.text: Really friendly staff, and a very warm and welcoming atmosphere.  And fresh bouquets on tables make this place even more lovely. Had the eggs Benedict special with beetroot hummus and a side of small french toast with fruits. Delicious food, great people. Will definitely come back for supper, there are some menu items I still want to try.

0YIYWVM5O84RWBT8YN3lSQ.text: The food was delicious!!! Service was great!!! Best scallops I've ever had I highly recommend checking this place out if you are in town. You won't regret it!

Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

APuc4b0kIC-W5EtMfEwKzA.text: After reading all of the great reviews on Yelp we decided that this would be our first meal in London. Naively we headed to Ffiona's on a Saturday night without a reservation and a group on 7!The placed was packed when we arrived at 7:30.  After walking 1.75 miles to get there I was suddenly filled with fear upon arrival that the rest of my party would be upset, to put it lightly, if we couldn't get in. We patiently waited 10 minutes at the door and then were asked if we had a reservation. No I respond with trepidation, um Ffiona says, I'm not sure we can get you in. A few minutes later a large group gets up and miraculously we are seated!If you want to dine here, be smarter than me and make a reservation.We were seated next to a regular who was kind enough to provide us with some recommendations.We ordered the beef and liver pie, so tasty.  The top is puff pastry the liver was perfectly cooked. Not grainy.The Hake(fish) was the best item on the menu!The fish and chips were well executed with a moist interior and a crispy exterior.The pork chop was the second best item! It was so moist and well seasoned.Mussels were good, everything was great. Do yourself a favor and come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pork chop so juicy

CkbLHrXhlrjrEYfBsGakxA.text: Very cute restaurant! The food was incredible! I had fish and chips and my friend had lamb with mashed potatoes. We were torn between the two so we shared. Both entrees were incredible! Our service was great. We opted for 2 desserts: sticky toffee pudding and a custard apple and blueberry crumble! I'm so glad I found this place on yelp. The restaurant has limited seating so be sure to make a reservation. You will not be disappointed

R_CE16xRo6Auxapim9IkVA.text: The best meal we had while in London!! What a pleasant surprise to find this little gem.  When we walked in Fiona herself seated us. She knew almost everyone that walked in the door by name.....if the locals are regulars you know you picked the right restaurant!!The restaurant has a very warm feel to it. Not only the decor but the staff as well. Our server was so helpful and nice. We never felt rushed. When I had a question about the wines, she brought me tastes of each! I had the most delicious scallops and the best sticky toffee pudding ever! I cannot day enough wonderful things about Ffiona's. Just do yourself a favor and go so you can experience it yourself!

er0z_wdSJ_5rXVZB0y-80Q.text: This lady in picture is racist. I am Asian. And I waited in the queue for the long time, but she only let others white people or family to go inside ( I know some didn't book) but let me alone. Even worse, a Middle East woman didn't make a reservation but came later than me but she let her in but ignored me and told me that there were no vacancy. We waited close to the door, but some other customers came in and there we're still gaps in the door, she was mad about that and shouted at me and my friends to close my door. Is this my responsibility to help you close the door if it's caused by others lady? If you want your customers to close the door. Why don't you be polite and I will feel more comfortable. This experience made me sad and disappointed, I wonder why where were still some people live in their small and unreasonable discrimination world？中国人不要来。这个餐厅服务员搞歧视。让中东人排在我们后面的还有白人先进（他们都是没有预约的），让我和我的朋友等了很久还不让我们坐下。告诉我们没有位子了。然后门是关不紧的，别人进来门没关好漏风，不是我们的问题，还很凶地让我帮她关上。服务态度极差！

GXbGVr6bT0vC0HdJ1YgJNw.text: We love this place! The staff is very nice and helpful. We tried the chicken kiev and pork chop, both were pretty good. Their cheesecake is amazing, not too sweet, not too heavy. If we visit London again, definitely will come back here. It was the best meal we had in London!

JUjWWqsLxnNAHX_OoPIlzA.text: The food was superb.  Staff was friendly.  The chicken kiev was fantastic.  the sauce was amazing.  the squash and apple crumb was also a delight.  the apple mojito was good as well.  i am glad i came here for my first meal in UK.  I would definately come again in the future!

-1pK9ao2UD1etvdNhtaENQ.text: Cozy restaurant, with good atmosphere. I had the Veal Chop which was very flavorful, my boyfriend had the Rump & Welsh lamb which was prepared very nicely. For dessert he had the lemon cheesecake and I had the chocolate vegan chocolate cake. Although I liked my dessert a great deal, I do have to say, the lemon cheesecake was hands down the best cheesecake I've ever had. Great place.

Zk-nzX_Z5TWWtsC74acsKw.text: What a wonderful find!!!!! We had the lamb and duck pate. Both were excellent! Nice friendly atmosphere and quant homey surroundings .Can't say enough good things about this restaurant. Obviously there were many regulars there injoying the food and company . Local or tourist, don't miss this gem !!!! Ffiona ROCKS!!!

Hqn8mlkAo5y9rOJpPUd5pg.text: My husband and I walked in without a reservation and were greeted warmly. The staff accommodated us despite having a full house. The food was terrific and the place is cozy and comfortable. Service was outstanding. Fiona herself is very involved and personally oversaw our experience.

wtTFeoqnhf0aIpO2K9qOaA.text: What a gem of a place! We had the Chicken Kiev and the lamb with a side of the carrots. All of it was absolutely delicious. We opted for the toffee dessert with ice cream, and were not disappointed. It was just the right amount of sweet. The restaurant is small but ever so charming. The owner, Fiona, treats her guest like family. Thanks for the wonderful meal! I'm glad I followed yelps advice.

k37omQvs4DzLU2IlKvcK0Q.text: We showed up Friday night without a booking (that's w/out a reservation for my fellow Americans) and the place was packed. We were nevertheless promptly and warmly greeted by our hostess, who I subsequently discovered was the owner, Fiona, who found a spot for us and provided us with  an excellent meal. My wife had the lamb, which was perfectly cooked and delicious. According to my better half it was right up there with the New Zealand lamb she has been rhapsodizing about for the last ten years. The new potatoes and braised red cabbage were perfect accompaniments. Unfortunately, I wasn't very hungry, so I just ordered the duck pate w/sourdough toast, which was also very good.  I wish I had been up to trying the thick cut pork chop. It looked delicious.  Despite the crowd, Fiona made a point of personally engaging each of her guests. We will definitely be returnees to ffiona's on our next trip to London.

LAKxKGHUJrn8V_-WiRAqaw.text: Outstanding menu. We had English roast beef, fish pie, pork chop- all excellent. Triple stars to the roast beef. We topped off with Sticky toffee pudding and English Mess.  Again, all winners, but triple stars to pudding. We were with a tour group, and I believe reservations are required. This is a small restaurant. Ffiona is warm and gregarious and her dishes are first rate.

4CUCcipaEJfEaggBKVsLYA.text: Just an absolute surprise and gem of a place. Her menu is a creative cross section, and the food is beautiful and fun. There is always something for everyone on the list, from fish to red meat to veggies and all of it top notch! We will be back any time we are in the area!

MVK2rCeeHXrT-bOC8WFe1w.text: Ffiona is a wonderful host and the food is fantastic. Cozy atmosphere.  The bread pudding is amazing.

GgLLtgQbYwweX-GE-66K7Q.text: We had our first London meal in this wonderful restaurant. The food was delicious, the ambiance was charming and the staff were excellent. There was a large, noisy party dominating the location while we were there and the owner expressed concern that it was disrupting our meal. We did not mind the party but did appreciate the extra attention she gave to our table to make sure that our experience was not ruined. We had a wonderful time. Do not miss the lamb or the sticky toffee pudding if it's available. That said, we loved everything we had. I would love to return to this establishment!

b6Lr7y852Ut0rp-T3ucnMg.text: Everything written about this place is true. The Chicken Kiev is heavenly. My wife, who is a picky eater, loved her seat trout and her kale salad was "spectacular". My daughter said her fish and chips were amazing. All of our other dishes were perfect as well. Best of all, Ffiona is a great hostess. We arrived at 6pm without a reservation and even though they were fully booked, she was able to squeeze us in. I'd recommend calling ahead for a reservation because this place is going to continue to be ultra-popular. Interesting that the power of Yelp had the place filled with Americans (Ffiona told us that the Brits don't use Yelp).

40Esg_l18lxpnqBIw03GZw.text: Went for dinner. Although it is pricy, the food is amazing!  Chicken meatballs were fantastic!  Husband had the pork chop and loved it. Roasted carrots were great also. So glad we live in the neighborhood

lVogjprHL8Q8wvKvd3_E-Q.text: Wonderful food and outstanding service led by Ffiona herself.  Friendly atmosphere where everyone is greeted and treated like a friend.

L1Kg_8sP84AmHMWdlVU30Q.text: Delicious British food. The Sunday roast is to die for. Wine list is fair. Staff is amazingly warm. Totally recommend.

hHHpPdypICc_KLWar_FOtw.text: Great atmosphere , very good food. Super host, Ffiona herself. Went for dinner and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Candlelight and all. Book in advance as there is limited seating ,average pricing for good food in London.

VEefGny7x7mbMvHk_2TemQ.text: Charming little restaurant situated between High Street Kensington and Nottinghill Gate.  The decor on the exterior was what first got my attention, beautifully done and alluring.The night I went the electrics were being fixed so it was all candle light :-) as a sorry for the inconvenience Fiona gave us a complimentary glass of bubbly. Now that's customer service. The food and dessert that followed was amazing, perfectly cooked and hot too. I'd so recommend this place, just make sure you book in advance

mxEMnio4c5h3FcKF1njpkw.text: There is only one thing to say - the best meal I have had in years! If you only have brunch/dinner in one place in London come to ffiona's :)

opQOe4hzZSiN9g3k3jlpyA.text: The lady running this restaurant couldn't be kinder. The service was very good, and the atmosphere is unpretentious and cozy. The full English breakfast was delicious!

tUHoK1-i4x2YkWN81Ax11Q.text: this is in the wrong price bracket - there is nothing "moderate" about dinner at ffiona's. the food is good, but we paid thirty pounds for a single chicken breast when we ate there last winter. literally.

iCybiX5F33ffmP1tndL3DQ.text: Easily the best meal I've had in my many trips to London. Everything was spectacular, especially the eggplant appetizer and the chicken meatballs. Sticky toffee pudding dessert was a must. Dinner made better by the incredibly friendly, helpful, and personable staff who struck the perfect balance of talking to customers at their tables without being annoying or overbearing. I'd like to go back on this trip and would certainly return on any future trip to London.

s82xAzkXUMZTYkQGNW0ziQ.text: Good variety in such a small menu. Quite inventive, and a sassy proprietor. We had the grilled avocado (can't wait to try grilling it at home), carrot & chili fritters and chicken Kiev. Excellent neighborhood find.

DZBCJOhTZbHcFhVYR8sVtw.text: Cozy, good food, reasonable prices.  Fiona provides personal service.  A great restaurant in a nice part of London.

0FC_NZSrwwcIMgFWxqI30Q.text: The concierge at our hotel recommended Ffionas, and after checking Yelp we decided to give it a try.  I had the grilled avocado (absolutely delicious) and the roast lamb with new potatoes (also excellent). My husband had a salad and the spicy chicken breast with mashed potatoes, which he raved about. It's a very small place and by the time you leave you feel like a regular. While eating the service was professional and top notch, after we asked for our check Ffiona sat down next to us and as she was hand writing out the check we chatted with her for quite some time.  I am not usually one to chat with strangers, but she is totally engaging.  We will definitely be back next time we're in London.

NQCob6o1iqF6Ow_g9sxtzw.text: Cute restaurant, delicious food!  Thank you for the fabulous time and for taking us despite our late arrival close to closing time.Will update with details later.

e7GGiO07pEFQtfriEh4_vA.text: Fiona was so kind and welcoming. You can tell she loves people and works hard!!  We had the lamb and chicken and leeks pie. Both were exceptional. The Macau Fizz cocktail to begin was amazing. I had two!!!  Desserts were incredible. We had the sticky pudding and the ginger mascarpone cheesecake. Will definitely come back next time we're in London!!!
