xbe9-IrH8qu9y_2Z_FMeDQ.text: I never write reviews, but this is a special place.  If you are far away from home but want to feel as if you've suddenly walked into your favorite home town restaurant - this is the place.First on the food.  As has been stated in other reviews, this is wonderful British comfort food.   For starters, we had the vegetable soup which was excellent.  It's made with all natural ingredients, but rather than tasting vegan and bland its incredibly flavorful.  Even more surprising, it's very substantial even though there are no heavy additives such as cream.My wife had the lamb and I had the hake prepared in the style that they normally prepare the cod.  Again, both were excellent.  The lamb was prepared to the optimal temperature and was tender and moist.  The hake was perfectly seasoned.Do yourself a favor.  Suspend the diet and have dessert.  We splurged and had three - the sticky toffee, apple crumble and the lemon cheesecake.  We were scrapping the bottom of all 3 plates minutes later.  For hard core sweet tooth eaters like me, the sticky toffee is heaven.  The lemon cheesecake was made with a ginger snap crust.  If you like the graham cracker crust that typically comes with key lime pie - this crust takes it to a whole new level.  The apple crumble is for the folks that like medium to light sweet desserts.Second, the service and atmosphere.  As amazing as the food is, this is actually the best part.  It's a small and cozy place that feels like a living room in your favorite relative's home.  Fiona and her team are one of the most warm and caring groups that you'll find in a restaurant.  I'm not talking about insincere chit chat or cold professionalism.  They treat you like you just married their favorite sibling or cousin.  When you ask for recommendations, they don't just replace your preferences with theirs and tell you what they like or what is "popular".  They actually listen to your likes and dislikes and give you recommendations to help you have the best meal for you.  Most importantly, they really care if you like what you have.  Enjoy!

HzF6JwxKLji68Lmz482iRw.text: On our short stay in London, we were lucky enough to stumble upon Ffiona's on our first night. We hadn't heard many good things about British fare but this place proved that wrong. It was a very cozy, hospitable atmosphere - although the benches by the window weren't exactly the most comfortable. He had ordered the pork chop which was cooked perfectly, well seasoned and not dry like most pork chops with a side of the best mashed potatoes he claims he has ever had. I had ordered what I thought was the special with hake but received a dish with veggie noodles which was amazing by itself (warm zucchini noodles w/ carrots, multigrains and nuts). I had asked where my hake was and I guess there was a misunderstanding when I had ordered. Fiona had rectified the problem right away - my hake came quickly after. For dessert, we had to try the sticky toffee pudding which was a tad too sweet for us but my teeth were still intact after finishing the whole thing! I was actually not feeling too well from walking around in the cold rain, but the food here LITERALLY WARMED MY SOUL. It was the first time I felt warm ever since arriving. Service was excellent. Times are posted on the door - we were sad we wouldn't be able to make it back for another meal. We will visit this place the next time we are in London for sure!

pQJEg1TOiLnI6253_PoUgg.text: From appetizers to desserts, this was delicious. Make sure you're ready to order when they're ready. The food is worth it.

yNDw0jWvKXkjGiotsoE8Tg.text: Ffiona is a trip! She is THE reason to visit this tiny, kinda run down storefront in a great part of London near Kensington Gardens.Lamb is outstanding. Prices are quite high for a table with paper napkins - CHEAP paper napkins! Small and cheap paper napkins!Our tab was L140 - that's about $220 for two. including the small and cheap paper napkins!For that much I would expect a real cloth napkin.Overall - the quality of the food and the endless jabs by Miss Ffiona made it a night to remember.Visited May 2015

EefJUQ4ls3uHlZ_6IddsEA.text: We went to Ffiona's based on the reviews from fellow Yelpers. Good choice. Nice little place, quiet music in the background. Casual but very nice. Good variety on the menu. I had the Venison and my lovely wife had the Chicken Kiev. We ended the meal with the Sticky Toffee Pudding. Great meal and Ffiona was charming and made us feel welcome. The food was very good and made for a nice evening. Go. Eat. Have a nice time. We're going for brunch this Saturday. Yum.

GXfKK634sCAuZbjR_oWoFQ.text: What more can I say but YUMMM! We found this place through Yelp while on holiday and scattered over Saturday morning still half asleep. They squeezed us in since we didn't have a reservation and we are SOO happy they did. The food was amazing and the restaurant, while small, is adorable! Service was quick and the ladies serving us (I believe one of them was Ffiona herself) were great. We got an order of their waffles, the queens special, and an eggs Benedict. While everything was tasty, the waffles were on a whole other level! Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The waffles alone are worth the trek!

ty2pNw-5KqsfMPejA_90mQ.text: I'm sad I haven't written this review yet. We went to Ffiona's about 7 months ago on the the last leg of our trip to London and Paris. We had the most delightful meal at Ffiona's on one of our first nights back from Paris to Kensington. The chicken Kiev was off the charts amazing. The service was as great as the meal. We had our 3 year old daughter with us, who is (apologies for gloating) an excellent traveler and amateur restauranteur , and the staff could not have been anymore accommodating to her dairy/soy allergies as well as just being very nice by talking to the kiddo and kept her entertained. We had such a pleasant experience that we made reservations for brunch on our last morning in London, but when we got there, there was some sort of problem with the gas lines for the kitchen. Fiona came right out, remembered us right away (we were only there the night before or so) and was sincerely apologetic. Not only was she so apologetic, but she sent us to another restaurant nearby that had an excellent breakfast (Fiona said it was where she gets breakfast when she's not working, which is apparently never). I need to head back to London soon, because if the brunch is half as good as the chicken Kiev, I'd consider moving out of New York!!!

r0L1bRJ8zmZANW7ApUzEOg.text: Will update from this draft.Everything was a 10!  Amazing dinner with our party of 6. Small restaurant with personal service.Crisp and strawberry mess desserts were amazingSeatrout was a 102 fish chips were excellentLamb was a 10Courgette sweet potato hazelnut pesto for our vegetarian was a 10

g_RoJdV-ruDWwtZET5wDBg.text: Came here based on a Yelp review with some work mates. It couldn't have been a better choice. The hostess was funny and charming. They also were able to fit us in without reservations. The food was spot on. I highly recommend this place for anyone near the Kensington area.

nKrvr5mzhBtm0F_E7-Y73A.text: Ffiona's was our first brunch spot in London. It was a lovely little cafe with good food and a cozy atmosphere. I had the English Breakfast and my fiance had the pesto eggs Benedict. They were both delicious. The sausage and tomatoes with the English breakfast were particularly tasty. I highly recommend the pesto eggs Benedict as the pesto was delicious and the combination of flavors was really nice. We went on a Friday at 11am and were the only ones there which made for a nice private brunch. I imagine it gets really busy on the weekends. The owner was there and both her and the server were really nice. Quick tip for U.S. visitors, bacon in the UK is more similar to salted ham. It is still pork and delicious, just prepared differently.

-5FpTWgsWU29nxxYZUptew.text: I like to travel and I like to eat, so I know a good spot when I find one. This is a great spot. Not good, great.Ffiona is awesome. Friendly, entertaining, hospitable. The food is amazing, balanced, interesting and delicious. The atmosphere is intimate, cozy and friendly. This was probably our favorite restaurant in London. Go. You won't regret it.

WzsFmwFPMtCGw8dMTfuG9w.text: It is warm, and welcoming, and charming, and delicious.Go to Ffiona's.  Eat at Ffiona's (the restaurant).  Be charmed by Ffiona (the person).  Leave a happy happy person.  THAT'S THE EQUATION.When Ffiona recommends a dish...go for it.  Tonight's deliciousness was the fish and chips which was...in a word: perfect.  Perfectly crisp cod, delicious minted peas, and absurdly crisp hand-cut chips.  The tartar sauce?  It left you forgetting what malt vinegar and ketchup even are.  That good, yes.Other deliciousness: lots of veggie sides, including a parmesan rocket salad and creamy-and-flavourful mash with leeks.  Opt in to that, folks.  As entrees stand-outs are the chicken kiev (purportedly the "best in the world", and I'm not arguing) and the massive chunky pork chop, perfectly cooked and served with the appropriate knife to cut through that porcine treat.  Good mix of boozy as well as virgin cocktails.  Solid house wine.  Massive pitchers of tap water (appreciated) with generous amounts of ice included (for this North American this is *especially* appreciated).  Desserts include a lot of British classics...sticky toffee pudding, bread and butter pudding, crumbles, etc.  But these are no standard classics.  Feeling too full by the end?  Split one in lieu of opting out together.  TRUST.Yelp note: reservations recommended; it's a tight spot, and you'd hate to get to 51 Kensington Church Street and be turned away at the door.

PeUcbMm7VmnTyrSmIftREA.text: We went with our two teens and though the last table in the house didn't feel rushed at all. The food was terrific and the service excellent. Would highly recommend. The entrées were fantastic and plentiful. Leave room for dessert. The toffee pudding and crumble with custard are delicious. Ffiona gave us some great tips on other London spots as well. Lovely evening.

W4Zy3OVV3nY7AlzpeOuwkw.text: Best meal I've had- everything was fresh and flavorful. Make sure you get a reservation--it's a small space and very popular, but definitely worth it.

cbWjiu_dEk96eKkVvAoeTw.text: How lucky were we that someone told us that we must go to the Churchill Arms for a pint or tow and how lucky were we that Ffiona's was just down the street. After doing a quick Yelp search, checked the reviews and menu and were out the door to have dinner at this quaint 5 star.  It was early for dinner by NY standards, we were that at about 6:30pm, the restaurant is small, but super cozy. We're asked if we have a reservation and are told they are fulling booked the entire evening. As we sadly go to leave, we are stopped by Ffiona herself as she asks if she could "squeeze" us into the corner of a large sharing table. We all noticed how nicely the table was divided by several vases of flowers and flickering candles. And we had a window seat which was just lovely to see the local scene is this cute Kensington 'hood.Ok, lucky us! We got a great seat and we're hungry and ready to eat. Ffiona told us about the specials and told us the menu was written on the wall, I hopped up to check out the offerings. We decided on a warm avocado salad, the avocado was smooth and creamy and perfectly ripe, it was somehow warmed on the skin and then plated with some micro green and delicious pesto dressing. Ffiona told me of the fish pie, I've never heard of this British fave, and wasn't sure about ordering it, so glad that I did....It was so good, hot and creamy and filled chunks of salmon and cod in a tasty while sauce and topped with mashed potatoes that we're lightly browned. It was a bowl of pure heaven. Friends had the fish and chips and the chicken Kiev, all got rave reviews! Ffiona pops by often to see how we like everything and then comes by to tell us about her homemade deserts. She offers a blueberry and apple crisp that is served with ice cream and a bread and butter pudding that just came out of the oven. I think she mentioned one or another, but we glazed over and ordered both of those and were so happy we did! Perfect end to a perfect meal. Ffiona comes by one more time and sits down with us. Asks where we are from and tells a story of coming for a visit to NY when she was just a child. We don't want to share her with the other tables, but she needs to tend to all. She asks what we had and scribbles down a check for us. Such an awesome time and fantastic hospitality Ffiona! I only wish you were around the corner in my 'hood here!

r52zrOXem7xc_qLKeajX1g.text: Keeping with the 5 star trend because its true. Great little spot with probably the most engaging owner of any restaurant I've been to. She was very friendly and gave us recommendations off her menu that lived up to her descriptions. The food is delicious.

D1J36w-RTWZRJj2eP7z2PQ.text: Excellent food.  I had the lamb and it was cooked perfectly with an excellent mint sauce.  The others at my table had the chicken kiev and it was amazing.  Get the blueberry cobbler for dessert.  Excellent and very personal service. I will definitely come back here when in Kensington.

Vqnk_HNR-s1pEXWnOZ2SMw.text: Thrilled to have a brunch that is Gluten-Free!!!  Fiona is lovely the spot is lovely.  Definitely go if you are looking for a pleasant start to your day x

u5li99PpYwAGKA4mdI05UQ.text: Ffiona's has quickly become one of my favorite restaurants in London. The food is truly sensational, incredibly creative and fresh, and the staff, including the brilliant owner, are as nice as they come. It's really like having a gourmet meal in a good friends home. You are made to feel so welcomed and then you are lavished with a wonderful meal. Considering how good the food is, the prices are very reasonable. Favorites include the Sunday roasts, the to-die-for Chicken Kiev, the Steak and Kidney Pie, and any lamb dish the wizard chief decides to make. Desserts that send me to the moon include the best sticky toffee pudding I have ever had, and the fresh fruit cobblers with a creamy vanilla custard. Amazing dining. I want to wrap my arms around Ffiona's and take it home with me.

vEO2kFGlEBZDvZ-FV1c65g.text: The owner was soooo nice and welcoming. I was visiting alone, and she made time to come sit with me a bit and keep me company. Great drinks and good food. While listening to her explain the menu, you could hear her passion for food and her restaurant. The work showed it.

WSQguIDYYjzNEUdte6Qc7Q.text: Super cozy space! It feels like you're sitting in Ffiona's living room. Called in earlier in the afternoon and booked a table for 5. Food definitely feels homemade and is mostly delicious! I especially loved the fish dish that I got to try from my friend. Ffiona seems super friendly too.

xwRf-DQWPfiN8umE9p13qQ.text: Had the most amazing meal here tonight. I am only in London for a few nights but just made another reservation to come back again before I leave. Five star gourmet food. I had the hake fish. It was delightful. Yum yum yum!

hA1Fuxbrw6NBWDTnM4fBuQ.text: Excellent meal.  Every dish was delicious, creative and unique.  The owner there directing everything.  The restaurant itself is very small.  And the only reason no five stars is because she kept reminding us she needed the table at 9:00 (it was only 7:00)

RU5qilVRdvtAzJL8qwdplQ.text: This is a gem in the heart of Kensington.  Seems to be a small family restaurant, cozy, charming and well located.  The food is amazing and the service is at the same level as well. Don't expect to eat a quick bite. This is a place to enjoy and savor.

qJ-_43ReAKgL6RQmvM5djg.text: Fantastic food and excellent service. A lovely place to eat home made British dish favorites. We have the chicken Kiev and the fish and chips and they were fantastic. Wonderfully flavored, the breading was perfect. For dessert we had sticky toffee pudding and the apple and blueberry crumble. Make time for this stop! We came on a quiet night but I think normally it would be better to have a reservation. We will probably make time to come here again before our trip was over. 5 stars just isn't enough!

Qfo26z33FRX3teiKpWnS_g.text: I was swayed by the ratings to have dinner on August 10th, the food was very good except my pork chop was undercooked.  I can count on one hand the times I have sent back food and this is one of them.  The chef apologized and cooked it to the correct temperature.  All great until I called back the next day to check on a hat I had left.The sister working the night before answered and was very nice, said "they had found a hat", and to stop by after 6pm (August 11th...today) to pick it up.  She then called me later today and said the hat was no longer there and suggested it was not the same color as mine, but she'd call me back if another hat was found.Here's why I am writing this post...I just called to check if anything was found, as I'm flying home (to the US) tomorrow.  The other sister (working tonight...August 11th) answered, and while she was initially indifferent, she ultimately became hostile and suggested I was implying they stole my hat.  I was surprised by her hostility, by her lack of concern and by her complete lack of customer service.  I had her on speaker phone, so my wife and daughter heard the conversation from our hotel room, both were "shocked".I am well travelled and have eaten at many restaurants all over the world...my recommendation is to avoid this restaurant...at least on the night this sister is working!  Actually, she appeared to be the owner/manager, so I'd avoid it on all nights!!

MCH5NCdKDHOJD-JHgM_d4A.text: Absolutely delightful restaurant.  Food, ambiance, service all outstanding.  In the last 10 days we have dined there twice, the first just trying it out and the second because it was so good.  Ffiona herself adds to the evening by occasionally sitting down and chatting. And given the intimacy of the restaurant you chat with a nearby table.  It just added to the overall experience.  Highly recommend Ffiona's

hX7MBPTQARcEtnaQTJzRxg.text: Ffiona's Restaurant is a true hidden gem of London. Run by Ffiona herself, this spot serves up incredible, British inspired dishes with gourmet spins in a cozy, casual yet slightly elegant environment. When we arrived at Ffiona's, we were warmly greeted by Ffiona, though we were told dinner was full. Luckily, there seemed to be a no-show for a reservation so she told us if we just waited 5 minutes and the reservers didn't show then we could have their table. As luck would have it, 5 minutes passed and Ffiona had us seated, telling us she was happy to serve us! Bare in mind, this is a small establishment with limited seating within limited hours, so you may want to make a reservation; not all could be so lucky! We had wine and were served delicious warm bread and butter as we looked over the fantastic menu. Ffiona has many British classics on the menu and all sound delicious. We began with bowls of the Homemade Vegetable Soup; so comforting after being outside in the cold rain. A pea centric dish, it was simply delightful; light but rich! So many mains to choose from, but there was a special on we just could not pass up: Traditional Roast Beef with Housemade Horseradish, Yorkshire Pudding, Potatoes, Braised Cabbage, and Glazed Carrots. Truly and honestly, this meal was DIVINE! I don't normally eat a lot of beefy meals, but it just seemed right being in England in the chilly Autumn. The beef was tender and rich in that way only beef can be. The beef soaked up its own au jus sauce around it and it's richness was cut perfectly by the Housemade Horseradish, which was sharp but much smoother and less hot than the jarred version. The Yorkshire Pudding was fluffy and savory, a perfect vehicle to soak up more of that au jus. The potatoes were so beautifully crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the cabbage and carrots were earthly and sweet respectively; both balancing out the heartiness of the other elements of the entire dish. Truly a fantastic dinner! Also, I must note that Ffiona takes great pride in her food. This was a special of the day because she said she found some great beef earlier and bought it for the dinner hours. She is actively seeking out quality ingredients to make her meals. We were some of the last to get the roast beef as I heard her tell the server working with her that "there's no more beef"; this means that her team is working with quality ingredients that are fresh, and not over produced. It's refreshing! I have a lot of respect for this. We finished out the meal with the Sticky Toffee Pudding a.k.a. my new favorite dessert! A soft pound cake covered in a sticky toffee sauce reminiscent of caramel but with that more distinctive toffee flavor. I've never had sticky toffee pudding but always wanted to try it; I'm sure glad I did! Another great perk of dining at Ffiona's is Ffiona herself! She is out on the floor, taking orders, serving food, and causing laughter in her wake. She is jovial and full of life; she even sat down with guests to joke with them as she took orders and even danced while carrying plates of beautiful food to the excited guests. I could sit and talk to her all night!A close atmosphere, I also met another solo American traveler who I had come and sit with us to enjoy the lovely meal and awesome experience. This was a truly wonderful dining experience I will always remember as part of my time in London. The atmosphere, the new friend, the laughs and jokes with Ffiona, and the awe inspiring food. If you're in London for dinner, come here!

h9m4bxd3V03rr9HUNMoK9Q.text: Lucky find. Yelp scores again with ffiona's. Great branch but they fill up fast. Get here before 11 and you can snag a table before the reservations start pouring in on a Sunday.The owner is friendly and quick talking. Menu is robust. Gluten free pancakes, English breakfast and fruit locally sourced from Kent all make the list. Will definitely have to come back for lunch or dinner on my next trip.Was a quick bus ride from our hotel and easy to find on a cute block off the beaten path of Kensington High Street. I had the sweet potato chorizo hash which defies any stereotypes of English food being bland. Well seasoned ripe sweet potato with peppery chorizo and 2 fired eggs prepared to perfection.Also, fresh oj in the mimosa. Love.

s4b1SVkfbRH7i9KepJGpRg.text: Beyond reproach. Perfect food, well plated and seasoned. I had the chicken Kiev on my second visit and the beef and kidney pie on my first. I can't do it justice with words! Also Ffiona herself is just the best. She's personal, friendly and understands good service!I highly recommend this place!

D5OEHFuZ1bPs4mMVnrwqlg.text: Excellent food and fell in love with Ffiona! Will be back during future visits to London.

3pgMajvds0gAzB0VDC1wRQ.text: This review is solely on the customer service we received when we were at this restaurant. I say this because we never actually made it to ordering a meal before we left and went to another restaurant. We went this past Sunday (10JUN2018). After a 5 minute wait we were seated and handed menus. Along with the menus (which only had breakfast items and a few other options) there was a large chalkboard portion of the wall which had meal items as well. My wife does not like eggs so we were a bit worried that they were only serving their brunch menu at the time. We tried to flag the waitress 3 TIMES to no avail. She literally would not even look our way...the closest we got was her walking past us and in passing saying "i'll be right with you". After about 15 minutes of waiting she finally comes over and says "are you ready to order". We ask about the menu and are informed, at this point finally, that it was only the brunch menu. Had she taken 2 seconds to stop and answer a simple question we could have easily been on our way to another local spot. I know that during brunch places can get busy and hectic but it wasn't that busy at the time and she could have easily answered a really easy quick question.

qRHYAvLcZmoxgImAC3eg9w.text: Bottom line: Really good food with REALLY bad attitude that seems to be the owner's "shtick"The good: The food. Everything we ordered was top notch. I cannot deny that; from salads, to starters to entrees. The bad: Please check my reviews. I go out enough. I have never commented negatively on service. Ffiona's attitude is nothing short of insulting to the point it made us wonder if she had some sort of bigotted bias against Americans (?), Jews (?), people with children (!!!). The place has a note on the door stating it is child friendly. It is not. There are no high chairs. There is little tolerance for childish misbehavior. The owner and her employee were impolite to us. We were not offered deserts at the end of our meal to make sure we rush out to allow others to be seated. We were not presented the full range of options when we were seated (we know, because others in the restaurant received better care).

uw-9mjGSsiUNRU_xOCQhPg.text: Dear Ffiona, thank you for the most delicious meal and kindest service in all of London!  The food was outstanding and hospitality was top notched.  Definitely will be back for another hearty meal and of course your warm welcome! Hope to see you soon!!!  xxoo

K7G0psggkzY6-t54gNM2QQ.text: Everything was delicious. The Parmesan salad was lovely. The lamb was exquisite. The sticky toffee pudding was amazing. Ffiona was warm and friendly, and very accommodating to our gluten-free companion. We had the duck pate for starter and she brought out some gluten free toast for him, with extra pate! Wonderful evening and would come back if we are in town!

X8Qjk22Tm4qhA1a0T2eEQQ.text: We stopped in on a Friday afternoon for lunch. The location is small, probably can seat 20 people at once which is good so that the owner, Ffiona can interact with you. We had fish and chips and the soup and calamari. The fish was a thick piece fried to perfection with chips that were crispy. The soup was broccoli and it was excellent. The calamari was all rings and came with a nice aioli. Ffiona was pleasant to talk with and when she found out we were from San Francisco she talked alot of her travels to our great city.

SGsIAEUBlcTmEOJ4rMFJgg.text: What can we say? We loved Ffiona's! We had the prawns appetizer, fish and chips (We wanted authentic fish and chips at least once while in the UK!) and apple and blueberry crumble and we were not disappointed! I also had my first Pimm's Cup! Everything was wonderful! Loved how Ffiona sat with us, taking our order and ensuring our experience was great! So happy that we chose Ffiona's as our first dinner place at our first night of our first trip to London ever!! We can't wait to return!!

Photo of Ffiona's Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips

PxqJ2wFgTF0l8rkQb_b0nQ.text: We went to Ffiona's on our last night during a London trip in March. Months before our trip, our friend Lori S. had recommended we stop in at Ffiona's if we'd be in Kensington during our visit. On our last day, we found ourselves randomly just a few blocks away from the restaurant, so we called and got a table for dinner.We were so warmly greeted by Ffiona that I would have swore we were in the Southern US, not London. Ffiona is the brightest ray of sunshine that she could clear the sky on even the gloomiest of London days. She set us up at a table in the back and we all got settled in. We quickly glanced over the menu, with our party of four (me, the Mister, and his parents) deciding fairly quickly which delicious sounding items we'd have for dinner. For me, as soon as I saw fish and chips, I knew it had to be my final dinner of our trip. I found it to be just delicious and the perfect selection. The fish was nice, flaky, and the batter was wonderfully crisp. The chips were also great, along with the mushy peas! Just simply perfect, especially along with the bottled cider on the menu. I was one happy American tourist.For dessert, we had a wide selection of offerings, from sticky toffee pudding to just simple ice cream. We all chose something different and shared... leaving happy and satisfied.The best part was when Ffiona came over to check how everything was. We explained that we were on the last day of our visit and came to Ffiona's on Lori S.'s recommendation. She immediately remembered Lori from 3 years earlier and even knew what table she sat at. She was such a gem and let us record a little video with her to send to Lori in the states.Look, I am just going to put it out there. If I could have stuffed Ffiona into my luggage, she'd currently be living in Columbus, Ohio. She was such a delight and we felt such an immediate connection with her that it is heartbreaking that we live on the other side of the Atlantic. I don't know when I'll be back in London; but when I am, I'll be at Ffiona's!

F31ldbpSukEIl4v2Y_cA0g.text: The owner greeted us and was able to seat us without a reservation . My wife and I were looking for a delicious last meal during our stay in london. We had the avocado appetizer which turned me instantly into an avocado lover with its buttery taste and cooling greens. It was perfect blend of crisp and sweet And savory! We also had the asparagus which was pretty yummy as well I had the beef strips, not sure what it's called. It was delicious and I enjoyed it slowly. The pizzer  drink (spelled it wrong I think ) Was amazing though it looked weird with several leaves and fruits inside. We ended our meal with coffee with baileys!It's extreme coffee that's for sure.
